Tell Me Why: Where lies the truth?This review contains no major spoilers.-Overview-Tell Me Why is one of DONTNOD’s latest games and we can say it's inspired to the more famous Life is Strange series. It shares the same concept: two intriguing characters having powers that affect who they are, the choices they can make and the world around them. The story, the way the characters are and their relationships are all shaped by your decisions.   ⚡ Technical Points   ⚙️ PC Specs     + Great optimization, runs perfectly.- Some audio stuttering issues.  - i7 7700 HQ- GTX 1050 4GB- 16GB RAM- 1TB HDD- 1080p Display   -LEGEND-▲ = Positive▼ = Negative▲▼ = NeutralVisuals ▲Tell Me Why is set in a fictional town named Delos Crossing, in Alaska. It is a multicultural place, home of some Alaskan native communities such as the Tlingit, Haida, Tsimshian, Eyak and many others. The town, as well as the surroundings and every building or environment in the game, is portrayed beautifully, with much attention to details and small things that merge to create an immersive and atmospheric experience.https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2491697638https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2526899448Story ▲The game focuses on two main characters, named Tyler (previously, Ollie) and Alyson, who’re brother and sister. Tyler is a transgender man who spent a decade in a juvenile detention center after being considered responsible for a family tragedy shown at the start of the game, when he was still a female kid (Ollie), not transitioned yet. When he’s finally granted to exit from the center, he rejoins his sister in a wholesome sequence and together they go back to their hometown, Delos Crossing, where Alyson still lives, determined to find the truth about the tragedy and try to understand the reasons behind it. In this journey, they will face many obstacles, and realize they’ve been lied to by several people. Will they succeed in finding the truth about their tragic past? It depends on you. Be prepared to find out how it all ends.https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2526894675One important thing to mention is that both main characters share a power called “the Voice” which allows them to communicate only through their minds, without speaking. It also gives them the possibility to relive their memories in a direct, powerful way. They can basically experience them right in front of their eyes. They will use this power at their advantage as they try to discover what’s really behind their tragedy.I’ve said at the beginning that Tyler is a transgender man. In fact, the game is brave enough to do a step forward and try not only to represent the LGBT community, but also discuss what being transgender means, how being able to discover your true self affects you from the inside and often deals with the problems this can cause with other people, relationships and political/religious ideas. Other things related to the same issue are also discussed: therapy, conversion centers, conservatism, lack of psychological support, the importance of family and close people who really understand you. There’s also a secondary character named Michael, whom you’ll discover later on in the game, who’s gay. You can learn more about his background story too, if you decide to talk to him in different scenes of the game. So.. the question comes spontaneous: is the game “political”?The answer is: yes. And the game doesn’t try to hide it, even if not the entirety of Tell Me Why revolves around this topic. It’s what the game is and you can’t do anything about it. So what I recommend is that if you have certain ideas about the LGBT community and you don’t want to give this game a try to understand more about the topic, then don’t buy it. If you’re willing to open your mind and to experience a story that also deals with this, then you’re free to try it.Apart from this, another issue you can run into is the start of the game. It’s quite slow and can lead you to consider the story boring already, without trying it further. The more you progress, the more everything gets interesting. At the end of the day, it’s a very subjective story. Personally, I liked it. But I can’t say for sure that you will like it too. It’s something you have to decide for yourself if it’s worth to try or not, based on what the game is about and your ideas. If you’ve never played a similar game and you’d like to try the narrative episodic genre without necessarily trying Tell Me Why first, I highly recommend you to check out the Life is Strange series first and then come back to this.Gameplay ▼I would love to make a detailed, in-depth description of the gameplay but, unfortunately, there’s not much to talk about. Most of the game either consists of cutscenes, dialogues, or long walks and interactions with objects and memories through the power of “the Voice”. While the quality of animations and lip sync has significantly improved compared to previous DONTNOD titles, the quality of writing in dialogues has seen a decrease in my opinion.But let’s talk about the core of the gameplay: Choices.They are the most important thing in the majority of DONTNOD games, as they drive the story forward and progressively shape what your ending will be. However, in Tell Me Why, I consider them a waste of time and a wasted opportunity. While the story itself can subjectively be appreciated, the choices don’t really do much in building the direction of the story, and in the end it all feels worthless, as if these were just a forced insertion in the game to let the story progress. There are only two endings to the story, and while the voice acting felt great, the overall package of the gameplay just isn’t enough in my opinion, as the value of your choices is tremendously disappointing. Expect a full story-based game but don’t expect your choices to matter that much in the end.Soundtrack ▲▼DONTNOD is known and appreciated for putting a huge amount of effort in enhancing their games with remarkable, original soundtracks. However, this is not the case for Tell Me Why. I’m not necessarily saying that the track selection is bad, but it certainly isn’t memorable at all, none of them was really magnificent and overall they felt basic and underwhelming compared to the previous titles of the same studio.Rating: GoodClick here for the complete Rating ChartTell Me Why is a game that’s certainly not exceptional, especially when compared to previous DONTNOD titles. It’s sometimes frustrating as you feel the wasted opportunity developers had to make some aspects of the gameplay better, but overall feels adequate enough to get you through the end of the game. The story is the strongest point in it, and definitely carries the game forward. While the cons previously described do not make buying the game at full price a wise choice, I consider the game to be a nice pick if found at a discount or even for free like it has been during June.  Liked this review, and want to see more of the same quality? Check out Shy Review Archive.

Watch Dogs 2: Everything's ConnectedThis review contains no major spoilers.-Overview-Watch Dogs 2 is the sequel to the original Watch Dogs. It's set in San Francisco, a good-looking city, that has little representation in this genre, apart from GTA: San Andreas back in 2004. In the metropolis, everything's connected with the new ctOS 2.0, a computer system originally designed to manage the infrastructure of Chicago during the events of the first Watch Dogs. CtOS 2.0 is an improved version of it. The story focuses on a group of young characters who want to change society. You assume the role of Marcus Holloway, who joins a group of young hackers named DedSec to take down Blume, the corporation who invented ctOS. You don't need to play the first game to experience Watch Dogs 2, as it focuses on totally different characters in another city.-Summary-   ▼ Cons   ▲ Pros     1. Questionable level design in some missions2. Sometimes invasive UI3. Amendable driving  1. Lively, bright view of San Francisco and its surroundings 2. Overall good gameplay and hacking system3. Stealth mission design is well done4. Nice soundtrack and radio stations5. Detailed and advanced skill tree      ⚡ Technical Issues   ⚙️ PC Specs     - Noticeably high RAM usage, even with low settings. - The game is unplayable with 8GBs of RAM if installed on an HDD, despite what's written in minimum requirements. - Plays better on an SSD. - Alt-tabbing may rarely cause crashes. - Minor bugs in Ubisoft style.  - i7 7700HQ- GTX 1050 4GB- 16GB RAM- 1TB HDD- 1080p Display   -Deep Analysis- ▲ Pros1. Visuals There have been only a few times where I've been totally immersed in a game's environment, and Watch Dogs 2 is one of these cases. San Francisco here is alive, technological, and stunning to look at. Whether you're crossing the Golden Gate Bridge, or doing parkour to reach the peak of high buildings, the city always looks gorgeous. It is also full of secondary quests and side activities to do. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=24464076222. Gameplay The gameplay of Watch Dogs 2 is well-crafted and can bring you many hours of fun, most of it definitely comes from the hacking system. In this game, everything revolves around hacking. Unlike in games such as GTA, it's recommended to think of a good plan before going on a mission. In fact, if you're good enough, you can play almost every mission silently. There are two devices (apart from your smartphone, which takes care of most of the hacks) that can help you a lot in planning the best way to do a mission. The first one is called the Jumper, and the second one is the Quadcopter.The Jumper is a ground drone, and it's the most useful object in the game. It can help you spot enemies and analyze the place of a mission before physically going there. It can also unlock doors, getting special permissions, and complete many mission objectives. However, it can also be easily spotted, so you have to be careful when going around with this little thing. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2471041185 You can do the same with Quadcopter except it can fly.https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2471041104 3. Stealth System As previously mentioned, thanks to the hacking system and some other useful tools such as the taser, you can do a lot of missions without getting your hands dirty. To get the best possible result, you have to use a combination of all the gadgets you have at your disposal. While the Jumper and the taser are available from early on, the Quadcopter is a device you have to buy separately with ingame currency. I'd recommend getting it as soon as possible. 4. SoundtrackI really liked the soundtrack of this game. There are many good songs, even famous hits, all available while you're driving or through the Media Player app on your phone. You can listen to them anytime you want. Not all of the songs are unlocked from the start, but you can unlock other ones through Soundcloud, an app on your smartphone similar to Shazam, which recognizes new songs and directly adds them to the Media Player app.5. Skill TreeThe ability tree in Watch Dogs 2 features a nice and varied set of skills you can unlock or improve to push your hacking, aim, or driving to the ultimate level. There are a lot of cool options, for example you can unlock a massive hack that causes all cars to go hay-wire. Crazy! ▼ Cons1. Level DesignNow, it may be me..but in some cases, the level design was quite confusing. A few times, I didn't know what I should do, or where I should go, and had to go to YouTube to find out. I don't consider this a major flaw, but still I had to talk about it. 2. Invasive UIIf there's something I dislike about this game, it's about the UI. I think that overall it's really great, but sometimes it becomes too much invasive for my taste. For example, there's a persistent white dot at the centre of the screen and I don't know why it's there. When you're driving a car, it's still there. I was annoyed by it and decided to install a mod to remove it, and nothing changed in my gameplay, so I really can't understand why they did that. Then, there's a skill which lets you know when some random NPC has a lot of money in his bank account, so you can hack it. However, the way the game notifies you of that is quite annoying. It shows four blue lines in the form of a square around the NPC, and that thing lasts quite a while. The problem is that the game notifies you of it even when you're inside of a building and you can't see the NPC, or when you're on a mission, and once you unlock the skill, you can't disable it. If you're annoyed by this kind of things, you'll probably be bothered by this one too, but once again.. it's not that big of a deal.3. DrivingI feel like the driving in Watch Dogs 2 is too much arcade-ish. I don't really know how to describe it, but it's like if some vehicles are too slow and others are too fast. The maneuverability of cars is almost the same for every vehicle, and the only thing that changes with different ones is just the speed and the design of them. It's worth noting though that it's not an issue that ruins the experience too much.Rating: Very GoodClick here for the complete Rating ChartPlaying Watch Dogs 2 is a really great and fun experience. The city of San Francisco is so alive and detailed that walking through it almost feels like going on a virtual tour. Listening to the ingame tracks while the protagonist has his earphones on is a nice detail too. The gameplay is great, the hacking system is amazing and everything feels like a well-crafted product. I fully recommend this game. Anyway, props to you, Ubisoft.  Liked this review, and want to see more of the same quality? Check out Shy Review Archive.

Mafia III: A Mixed BagThis review contains no major spoilers.-Overview-Mafia III: Definitive Edition is the latest title in the Mafia series (excluding the Mafia 1 remake). It brings a lot of changes compared to the previous chapters, both in the structure of its story and gameplay. This edition contains all the DLCs that have been released. The story focuses on Lincoln Clay, an US Army soldier who took part in the Vietnam Conflict and has experienced the horrors and the cruelty of war. Coming back home, he finds out his family is in trouble with a mob led by a well-known gangster named Sal Marcano. From that point onwards, he will try to help them, until a cruel unexpected betrayal happens and Lincoln's nightmare starts.-Summary-   🟩 Pros   🟥 Cons     1. Realistic, vibrant representation of 1960s New Orleans (named New Bordeaux). 2. Enjoyable gameplay mechanics. 3. A great story overall. 4. Amazing soundtrack with remarkable tracks and songs.   1. Bad pacing. 2. Poor balance of storytelling and gameplay sequences. 3. Too many repetitive missions, even main ones. 4. Dumb enemy AI and NPC behaviour. 5. Not much customization, some outdated mechanics.      🟨 Technical Issues   ⚙️ PC Specs     - FPS drops and occasional stutters.- Noticeable number of bugs and glitches of any kind. - Problems with story progression (you have to reload the checkpoint every once in a while). - Extremely bad optimization. Changing graphics settings doesn't have a big impact on performance. - Inconsistent, weird-looking graphics (good lighting, bad shadows, too much blur). - Pop-in/Streaming issues. - Alt-tabbing may sometimes cause audio issues.- Minor issues with key binding.   - i7 7700HQ - GTX 1050 4GB - 16 GB RAM - 1TB HDD - 1080p Display   -Deep Analysis-Pros1. Mafia III manages to deliver a great-looking representation of New Orleans in the 1960s, with details and vehicles faithful to that time, and the result is an impressive and immersive experience, where even driving a car around the city feels good, considering they also fully captured the beauty of the city's most important landmarks. Not only that, but there's also a rather large area of beautiful countryside to explore. The problem regarding the issue of racism and discrimination was well-explored too.2. New Bordeaux (This is what New Orleans is called in the game) is a city which feels alive and problematic. From systematic racism profoundly rooted in it, to mob wars and a big level of corruption, exploring the city can be a danger too. In fact, you can be ambushed, and if you don't pay enough attention, you could end up dead. The gunplay in Mafia III is well-made, and with the right choice of weapons, you can deal a lot of damage. But beware: the same amount of damage can also be dealt to you (depends on the difficulty level). Melee combat, on the other hand, is weaker, but feels more interesting thanks to the executions you can do.3. Despite being a simple "revenge story", the character arc of Lincoln Clay is what impressed me the most, as the way you can affect the progression with the choices you make, the people you'll decide to trust, and those you'll decide to kill. The game has three different endings. One of them also has different scenarios depending on your choices.4. The soundtrack of Mafia III is one of the best in the series, in my opinion even superior to the one in Mafia II. In fact, it amazingly captures both the game's atmosphere and the story. The OST and its songs really give the feeling of traveling across a city of 1960. There are also many hits from that time.Cons1. The game's biggest problem is the bad pacing. The most interesting facts are explained through flashbacks or flash-forward cutscenes, which can also happen in the middle of a mission, after getting a racket or through optional, skippable dialogues. In my opinion, the way they sorted everything was really bad, especially considering the game itself has a decent story.2. Strictly connected to the first problem, another issue I personally found is the bad balance of storytelling and gameplay. In fact, when a major plot point occurs, you'll find yourself forced to do a huge amount of activities before the story progresses again and this can lead to confusion, or it can just be boring.3. Many of those activities are so repetitive that, if you don't like the gameplay, or worse, hate it, it will be impossible for you to like the game or at least appreciate it. They tried to make it last too long, and eventually it turned on them. Fortunately, you can play DLCs while progressing in the main story if you get too bored of doing the same activities, and then continue the story later on.4. A huge step down from the previous titles is the AI. Oh, man, if I'm disappointed. In the first Mafia, if you went too fast and got spotted by cops, they would try to stop you and make you pay a fine. If you didn't, they would try to arrest you. In Mafia II, after escaping from the cops, if you were in a car, then that plate would be wanted by the police. If you were on your feet, your appearance would be wanted instead, and you could fix it by changing clothes for a while. In Mafia III, all of this attention to detail has vanished. You can drive fast and cops won't even notice you; you can carry a gun everywhere, and even if people will notice you and tell you to holster it, nothing else will happen unless you shoot. You can escape the police and still use your car like nothing happened. I was very disappointed in seeing that.5. Another downgrade is in customization. Just for reference, in Mafia II you could go to a clothing shop and buy new clothes, which would be added to your wardrobe. You could customize vehicles, and if your car was saved in the garage, those customizations would be saved too. You could go to a bar and buy a beer, a coffee or a snack. You could go to a restaurant and eat. In Mafia III, you only have a set of outfits to choose from. You can't choose individual clothes nor buy new ones. You can still customize vehicles, but since you don't have garages, those customizations would be a waste of money. That's another disappointment.Rating: AcceptableClick here for the complete Rating ChartAfter completing the main story, with all the secondary quests, and considering all the pros and cons mentioned above, I believe the game to be worth a shot, but you have to keep in mind that it's certainly the worst in the series. If you keep expectations low, you may end up liking it. If you can, buy the game on sale; I don't recommend buying it at full price.  Liked this review, and want to see more of the same quality? Check out Shy Review Archive.

"Всегда, всегда будет существовать тьма. И всегда будет таящееся в темноте Зло, всегда будут во мраке клыки и когти, убийство и кровь. И всегда будут нужны ведьмаки. И крайне необходимо, чтобы всегда они появлялись там, где в них нужда. Там, откуда доносятся крики о помощи. Там, откуда их зовут слабые. Чтобы они появились, призванные, с мечом в руке. С мечом, сверкание которого разобьет тьму, свет которого - разгонит мрак."© А. Сапковский. "Сезон гроз"Пан Анджей адресовал эти слова своим героям - ведьмакам. А я хочу адресовать их игре. Выходили игры до, и будут выходить после. Какие-то будут хорошими, какие-то - похуже. Но всегда будет "Ведьмак III: Дикая охота". И если захочется настоящей Игры, настоящей Истории, я точно буду знать, к чему вернуться.

Худшая игра в серии!А теперь по порядку и с аргументами.Сюжет. Война за независимость США. Судя по рекламным трейлерам игры, нас ожидало захватывающее приключение в исторических декорациях с масштабными эпическими сражениями. На деле же оказалось, что наше участие в сражениях ограничится артиллерийской стрельбой, лично мне напомнившей игру в боулинг (свалил одним выстрелом весь отряд противника, а ещё лучше 2 - страйк!).Главный герой. Главный герой представляет из себя что-то совершенно непонятное. Его поступки совершенно иррациональны. Его убеждения наивны. Его приключения не вызывают ни сопереживания, ни интереса. Обычно в играх я стараюсь ассоциировать себя с героем, попытаться понять его мотивы. Но я так и не смог понять индейца, мать которого убили, а он вместо того, чтобы идти мстить, отправляется в глушь к негру (да, в те времена негров ещё можно было называть неграми), от которого поначалу претерпевает лишь унижения. В итоге гордый и сильный краснокожий, который должен ассоциироваться с бизоном или мустангом, похож на глупого, но упрямого осла.Геймплей. Смешанные чувства у меня остались от геймплея. С одной стороны это старый-добрый Assassin's creed, но сюжетная глупость прорвалась и сюда. Герой скачет по деревьям, как Тарзан. И я не знаю, чем объяснить подобный способ передвижения. Морские сражения интересны, но не вписываются в общую картину игры. Создаётся ощущение, что Конор (героя так зовут) отреставрировал себе не боевой корабль, а прогулочную яхту для рыбалки и отдыха. Каждый выход в море интересен, но к сюжету отношения не имеет. Отдельно хотелось бы сказать про экономику в игре. Идея с производственными цепочками интересна, но очень неуклюже реализована. Очень много времени приходится уделять производству товаров, отправке караванов и прочей околоигровой ерунде. А враг-то не дремлет!Подводя итог, выделю плюсы игры: во-первых, это - Assassin's creed, во-вторых, интересное развитие получила история Дезмонда, в-третьих, морские сражения все-таки хороши. Минусы игры, к сожалению, все остальное.

DO NOT buy this game from Steam.-During installation the game is downloaded twice, reaching ~150 GB, with many people running into problems during or after that, having to look up guides online and delete files manually. -Their servers are very problematic, the ping for some being consistently over 100, frequently hitting 300, disconnecting you from the game at random or at times not letting you log in for hours.-Since the game is downloaded a second time through their launcher and their launcher running is counted as time spent playing, by the time you have managed to install it you are already well over the 2 hours limit for steam refund.This is the first game I have regretted buying on Steam, alas, I cannot refund it for the above reason. If you have a poor soul as a friend that has bought it through steam and you want to play with them, you will have no problem if you buy the game from the game's official site as there are just 2 megaservers, NA and EU.

TLDR: Good story , amazing graphics , amazing performance. A must buy for any zombie / open world action game fan.Ok ... now to the real thing:Absolute gem of a game. The graphics , the story , the amazing performance on PC it all adds up to being the definitive version of Days Gone. I nearly bought a PS4 just to play this game when it originally released 2 years ago. Now i'm glad i didn't because PC is definitely the way to experience this game. The story of the game is pretty long (around 40ish hours i'd say on hardest Survival II Difficulty) and it will take you across the many maps in the game. The world itself is pretty decent , decently sized and really detailed with some areas that really shine and look like they were made for taking screenshots :D Hence why the game has an amazing photo mode. Now to the negatives , i only had 2 problems with the game the first one being gunplay, that can feel a bit frustrating unless you use focus , which last for a pretty short time and has a pretty lenghty cooldown even when the skill is maxed out. And the other problem being that the game doesn't really encourage exploring because there's no real "reward" you get from exploration unless you are looking for some crafting ingredients or a gas can to top up your motorbikes fuel tank , which is a shame because they really did a good job with the world in this game.All in all i really enjoyed my time in the game and i really hope for a sequel. Pretty please with cherry on top make a sequel :D .
Exactly what this game needed. Still needs some polishing , but it's a step in the right direction.

I pre purchased the game and played on day 1 and i have to say the game was nothing short of a huge mess. The FPS were pretty bad , the graphics were pretty bad compared to JC3 and let's not even get started on the bugs that made the game pretty much unplayable, but ... but . I am very happy to say the game truly has been reloaded. It's exactly what you expect from a JC game in 2019. Top notch visuals , great optimization and gameplay .There are still some minor bugs, but they are the kind of bugs that make you laugh out hard LUL . So yeah , i would definitely recommend the game at this point. Amazing to look at and play with signature Just Cause gameplay . Thanks for making Just Cause great again Avalanche!

Bardzo dobra gra będąca analogią do tego, w jakim kierunku zmierza nasz świat. Korporacje, ciągła praca, coraz większe wymagania, rywalizacja i rozliczanie ze wszystkiego - to wszystko prowadzi do braku wolnego czasu, osamotnienia, braku znajomych i zagubienia sensu życia. Jednak nasz bohater powoli wyłamuje się z tego marazmu i jest to przedstawione w bardzo ciekawy sposób.W kontekście całej gry rozumiem żart twórców odnośnie osiągnięć, które można zdobyć w grze. Nie z fabuły, a z ... no właśnie. Mamy gry polegające tylko na klikaniu, jak również gry typu "tylko dla osiągnięć", i to zostało świetnie zaimplementowane w grze. Sam zresztą wpadłem kiedyś w tą pułapkę. Nie wiem, czy zdecyduję się na zdobycie wszystkich osiągnięć, gdyż ... zresztą zobaczcie sami. Gorąco polecam!A great game being an analogy to the direction in which our world is going. Corporations, constant work, increasing demands, competition and accountability for everything - all of that leads to loneliness, lack of free time, lack of friends and loss of the meaning of life. However, our hero slowly breaks out of this stagnation and it is presented in a very interesting way.In the context of the game as a whole, I understand the creators' joke about the achievements that can be obtained in the game. Not from the plot, but from ... well. We have click-only games as well as achievement-only games, and that aspect was very well implemented in the game. I myself fell into this trap once. I don't know if I will decide to get all the achievements, because ... see for yourself. I highly recommend!

Prosta, ale wzruszająca historia rozgrywająca się w realiach komunistycznej Polski. Miałem wtedy kilkanaście lat i wiele z tego pamiętam. Ciekawie oddane realia tamtych czasów i jest kilka ciekawostek z życia codziennego. Gra ma kilka zakończeń. Szkoda, że gra jest tak krótka. Mam nadzieję, że będzie dalszy ciąg. Polecam!A simple yet touching story set during the times of communist Poland. I was in my teens back then, so I remember a lot from them. The game pictures these times' reality in an interesting way and tells you intriguing facts about everyday life. It has a few endings. I wish the gameplay was longer and I hope that there will be a continuation. I highly recommend it!
Nie powinno być takich gier. Nie warto.There should not be such games. Not worth it.

Świetna gra logiczna. Naszym zadaniem jest skierowanie promieni lasera w odpowiednie miejsca przy pomocy róznorodnych urządzeń. Kolejne, coraz wymyślniejsze urządzenia poznajemy w kolejnych etapach gry. Pierwsze etapy gry są dość łatwe, ale kolejne stają się coraz trudniejsze. Gra ma prześliczną grafikę i bardzo przyjemne udźwiękowienie. Podczas gry czuje się magię poznawanego świata gry. Szczerze polecam.Great puzzle game. Our task is to direct the laser rays into appropriate places using a variety of devices. More and more sophisticated devices are introduced in the next stages of the game. The first stages of the game are quite easy, but the next ones are getting harder and harder.The game has beautiful graphics and very nice soundtrack. During the game we can feel the magic of the game world. I sincerely recommend.
Beautiful game! Relaxing, nostalgic with a great atmosphere. I would recommend to break the hardships of everyday life.

Bardzo mile spędzona godzina. Dobry klimat, ciekawie kontrastująca grafika, fajna muzyka electro. Wciągająca. Polecam.Very pleasantly spent an hour. Good climate, interestingly contrasting graphics, cool 80's synth pop music. Addictive. I would recommend.
Bardzo lubię tego typu gry, ale w tą po prostu nie da się grać. Szkoda.I really like that type of games, but unfortunately this one is just impossible to play.

Niesamowita. Wspaniała. Cudowna.Incredible. Great. Wonderful.Невероятно. Отлично. Замечательно.10/10This game transfered me to my childhood. It brought back a lot of my memories. Summer camps, first love, heart dilemmas, hard decisions (in young person opinion).Everlasting Summer gives such feelings in a great way, especially that i was teenager in 80s :)Stories told in the game are very interesting. There are plenty endings depending on our choices during the game. Some of them are really surprising.Also music is worth mentioning which helps to build the atmosphere in this production. Few melodies will stay in my head for a longer time. Can't say anything bad about graphics. The pictures are very nicely drawn.Furthermore, the game shows that our decisions have consequences in the future. They can affect the fate of others, even in a tragic way, so we should think twice before saying/doing anything. Much depends on the nature of the other person, but we are able to hurt anybody.I highly recommend this game, especially to the older generation of players.Mnie ta gra przeniosła w czasie do moich lat młodości. Obudziła wiele wspomnień. Letnie obozy, pierwsze miłości, rozterki sercowe, trudne decyzje (jak na tamten wiek).Gra niesamowicie oddaje ten klimat, tym bardziej, że nastolatkiem byłem właśnie w latach 80-tych :)Opowiedziane w grze historie są bardzo interesujące. Zależnie od naszych wyborów mamy różne zakończenia gry. Niektóre z nich są bardzo zaskakujące.Na wyróżnienie zasługuje również muzyka, która tworzy bardzo fajny klimat. Kilka melodii bardzo zapadło mi w pamięć. Podobnie grafika, która jest bardzo ładnie narysowana.Gra pokazuje ponadto, że nasze decyzje mają konsekwencje w przyszłości. Mogą one wpłynąć na los innych osób, nawet w tragiczny sposób. Nasze postępowanie nie jest bez znaczenia, dlatego czasem trzeba się zastanowić, zanim coś zrobimy lub powiemy. Wiele zależy od charakteru drugiej osoby, ale skrzywdzić można każdego.Serdecznie polecam tą grę, szczególnie starszemu pokoleniu graczy.

Co tu dużo mówić. Pozycja obowiązkowa dla fanów gatunku. Fabuła, grafika, muzyka - bajka.Bardzo dużo możliwości rozwoju postaci. Nic tylko tłuc potwory na potęgę przez wiele godzin i ratować świat przed złym.Po ukończeniu gry można zagrać ponownie w trybie "plus" z całym zdobytym ekwipunkiem i doświadczeniem.Koniecznie.What can I say. A must have for fans of the genre. The story, graphics, music - fabulous. A lot of character development possibilities. Nothing but defeat the monsters and try to save the world from evil.After completing the game we can play again in the "plus" mode keeping our equipment and experience.Necessarily!

Reklamować nie trzeba. Wspaniała gra interaktywna z możliwościami wielu trudnych wyborów.Cudowna wzruszająca opowieść o przetrwaniu w świecie opanowanym przez zombii.Pozycja obowiązkowa.Advertising this title is not needed. Great interactive game with the capability of many difficult choices. Very amazing and touching story about surviving in the post-apocalyptic world overrun by zombies. A must have.

Pomimo ogromnej fali   negatywnej krytyki, gierka według mnie sprawuje się   naprawdę dobrze. Nie mam praktycznie nic do zarzucenia, przez moje pierwsze   10h  rozgrywki nie napotkałem na żadnego  Glitcha . Gra sama w sobie jest przepiękna, niestety to piękno przekłada się na duże wymagania odnośnie sprzętu.Nie wypowiem się obszernie na temat fabuły gdyż w tym momencie jestem w jej nieznacznym momencie, pomimo tego wydaje się być bardzo rozbudowana i wciągająca. Co do całokształtu gry, na pewno jest ona godna polecenia każdemu, i z pewnością nadaje się na prezent dla   weekendowego  jak i   zaprawionego   gracza

theHunter: Call of the Wild™ czyli gra o polowaniu osadzona w przepięknej oprawie graficznej. Hunter jest  to bardzo specyficzna gra na ogół może wydawać się banalna, nic bardziej mylnego. Hunter jest naprawdę trudna grą. Ktoś  może powiedzieć podchodzisz strzelasz cała filozofia, otóż nie  zanim strzelimy czekają nas długie minuty tropienia zwierzyny. Najgorsze w Hunterze jest brak wszystkiego w pakiecie, kupując grę chcemy otrzymać jak najbardziej urozmaiconą rozgrywkę niestety hunter nie daje nam praktycznie nic. Dostajemy 2 rezerwaty i tyle, przemieszczanie się jest koszmarne aby przejść do jakieś miejscówki czeka nas bite 20-40 minut chodzenia lecz za jedyne 20 zł możemy kupić DLC z quadem. Jeśli mamy już quada zwiedziliśmy rezerwaty upolowaliśmy Jelenia lisa to rozgrywka staje się nudna ponieważ kończą nam się zwierzęta wiec developer udostępnia nam płatne DLC z nowym rezerwatem zwierzyną i tak w nieskończoność. Ciekawa gra w której łatwo i w krótkim czasie można nabić masę osiągnięć. Jest to ten tytuł którego raczej nie przechodzi się po dwa razy, ponieważ nie oferuje sobą nic ciekawego, oprócz wcześniej wspomnianych osiągnięć. Gra jest banalnie prosta każdy level różni się od siebie co sprawia, że gra nie jest monotonna. Jest to tytuł który nie wymaga dużego poświęcenia pod względem czasowym, ponieważ całą grę jesteśmy ukończyć średnio w granicach 1h-3h

The Forest jest to bardzo ciekawy tytuł  zapewniający wiele godzin rozgrywki. Gra surwiwalowa połączona z horrorem idealna na wieczór, jest ona owiana bardzo słabo rozwiniętym wątkiem fabularnym, żadnych scen ani dialogów. Na pochwale zasługuje dobra oprawa graficzna jak i ciekawe oraz naturalne zachowania kanibali, niestety nie można tego samego powiedzieć o zwierzętach niektóre potrafią biegać po dnie rzek wchodzić po bardzo stromych ścianach, co jest bardzo zabawne ale potrafi wybić z klimatu gry. Warto również zwrócić uwagę na to, że the forest w niektórych momentach jest straszny a w innych bardzo spokojną grą.

The gameplay is good and feels like a real Halo game.BUT: The game got big network issues. The netcode is bad. You will have 20-30ms Ping but big desync issues and die after running behind a wall. Shoots that should clearly hit the enemy will not hit, because the netcode and hit registration is badly written. It something that happens randomly, you will have random gun fights where hits are not getting registered multiple times in a match. Or where the enemy looks like he only 3-shots you but you already got 5-shotted with the BR, because the desync didn't let you see the other 2 shots.After +40hours in the game i can surely say the network issues are not some random and rare occurrences but a real problem. Playing competitive ranked with bad network problems and bad hit registration shouldn't be a thing.Before fixing the whole ingame shop and skin dilemma, they should fix the network issues. But that will take months, Battlefield took a whole year to rewrite their bad netcode.

This game has a special place in my heart.I have to say that I cried couple of times while playing this AMAZING game and I still can't believe I finally finished it.The feeling of freedom, sorrow, and loneliness... The game manages to touch your soul so well that it makes you feel like you are a part of Kasio's life. When you see   Kasio feel  'free'  for the first time, you cannot help but to get emotional. I know the feeling of being restricted and this game explains that moment, that moment of freedom, so well that you can't just let it go there.  Her life, her personality, everything about her makes you connect to this game even more.Also, as someone who is also a part of the LGBTQ+ community, I find myself relating to many parts of this game.It is a unique game, with its story, art style and, the charactersI highly recommend the experience, and I believe everyone can find something in this beautiful game. + Trans Rights!

All together have around 2k+ hours I have enjoyed the game all the way through, playing alone isn't the way to go usually, its the most fun with another person or 2. If you play it 24/7 for a couple weeks its usually a time for a little break but when you come back its just as fun as ever. Ranked: Of course ranked is a little rough alone, im around gc 2 and its not terrible with randoms but every now and then you get someone who should be in plat. I don't like the fact you que with someone who is 1400 and you are around 1550 then go against people who are 1600 or higher so there is no chance. Its fun meeting people to play with and learning more about the game with others, if you aren't toxic, usually people wont be toxic either, but its rocket league, there has to be some toxic somewhere.

All together this is a very fun game and I love that you can get pretty OP at times and I love that feeling when you one shot everything. I think the price could maybe a little cheaper but I mean what can you do. I really recommend this game to whoever could get it, its well worth the money I think.

Dieses Spiel ist eine Empfehlung wert.Ich persönlich habe nun die ersten 100std. hinter mir und mich langweilt dieses Spiel immernochnicht. Das mag an einer angenehm großen Auswahlmöglichkeit an Überlebenden und Killern liegen oder an abwechslungsreichen Spielen bzw. auch Maps. Das Online Spiel erhitzt schon mal die Gemüter, da man hier im eigenen Team oder bei den Gegenspielern auf echte Anfänger oder Profis treffen kann.Man ist leider noch nicht in der Lage alle Charaktere von Anfang an zu spielen, aber manche kann man mit einer etwas schwer zu verdienenden ingame Währung auch so freischalten oder im Durchschnitt für 6€ im Store bzw. im Sale noch billiger erwerben.Die Überlebenden und Killer sind recht ausgewogen wobei es bei einigen so erscheint als wären die Fähigkeiten etwas "overpowered" ..mit ein bisschen Spielerfahrung ist aber so einiges machbar also nicht den Kopf hängen lassen -> die Übung macht es.Es gibt zuweilen hier und da vereinzelte Camper-Killer, was ziemlich nervig sein kann aber auch hier lässt sich sagen das Campen nur relative wenig Punkte bringt und unlokrativ ist, es versaut halt nur die Runde.Dieses Spiel bietet leider keinen Gruselfaktor also spätestens nach den ersten 5 Runden nicht mehr, es kann aber trotzdem noch für Schreckmomente sorgen :,D und gegen Freunde zu spielen macht das Spiel gleich noch lustiger. Ihr könnt euch nach belieben mit einigen lustigen Outfits vollstopfen die aber keine weiteren Vorteile bringen. Bitte nicht Campen und keine Leute retten wenn der Killer direkt neben euch steht ..damit ist keinem geholfen und hast du eine Maske auf rennst du gefälligst nicht Raus! Das Spiel zeigt einem wenige brutale Szenen ..wobei ein freiwiliger Splatterpatch schon lustig wäre macht es das Spiel nicht uninteressanter.Habt Spaß!

Das perfekte Spiel zum Starten in eine gemütliche Zockerrunde, denn nach diesem Spiel sollte es eigentlich nur noch Bergauf gehen.Ich persönlich spiele das Spiel immer wieder in regelmäßigen Abständen mit Freunden zusammen und bin bei den meisten "Runs" immer wieder unterrascht. Die Waffen voll aufgewertet mit soviel rückstoß-reduzierenden Bauteilen wie nur möglich und dennoch lauert hinter dem nächstem Stein jemand der es mit vollautomatischen Waffen schafft dich weg zu pusten ohne auch nur anzuvisieren. Das liegt entweder daran das der "Spray" in der Maus vorprogramiert ist oder man sich den gestreiften Fallschirm für 5€ zulegt und einen Bonus für fleißige Kaufkraft bekommt.Sie können dieses Spiel natürlich auch für die wunderbaren Kisten die sie beim ersten Kauf bzw. nach 700 erfarmten Battlepoints ihr Eigen nennen können spielen. Der Preis verdoppelt sich bei jedem Kauf und es besteht eine Chance das sie eine coole verschlossene Kiste bekommen für die sie einen Schlüßel für 2€ zusätzlich kaufen müssen um dann doch noch ihren ersehnten 3cent LOOT zu bekommen.Einsteigertipps: -Wenn jemand am Boden ist, wird nachgetreten!-Campen sie auf jeder Brücke (vorallem Brücken) und in jedem Haus das sie finden können!-Wenn sie auf fahrende Fahrzeuge schießen sprayen sie wie wild hinterher ...sie treffen dann schon!Es ist an sich wirklich ein Spiel das auch spaß machen kann..aber es sind immer wieder Kleinigkeiten die sich summieren und manchen Abend früher enden lassen als man es geplant hat.

One of the most immersive games I've played ever. Normally, I don't enjoy singleplayer games. I prefer playing with some mates or just run around in an online open world. But when I listened to a podcast on Spotify (Dutch one named Nerd Culture) I heard KeokeN's story and learned about their game. After listening one hour straight to two dedicated indie studio owners, I knew I had to check it out. Visiting the Steam Store and checking the game made me really excited because it looks very similar to the brilliant movie Interstellar, which is my favorite movie of all time. Let's give it a try and oh boy, I was hooked. The graphics are perfect, the movement is decent (good enough) and the storytelling is by far one of the most immersive stories I've seen in a game. Halfway the game I found out it was a puzzle game. The story don't really gives you the feeling it's a game, but more of an experience. Puzzling is just finding solutions to solve some tasks ingame. Nothing stupid with forced puzzles that don't fit in the theme of the game.After 5 hours of playtime, checking all the spots and easter eggs (I found your dev team group photo with your suits on!), I realized it was a short game. I understand why people don't want to pay 20 euros to play a game which has no replay value and only 5 hours. Nonetheless, I think it was all worth it. It got me hooked like Firewatch, which was also very short but had an amazing story. I don't really mind waiting for the next chapter in the story, because I know you need money to produce the second part. TL:DR:]Interstellar + puzzles + gaming + 20 euros to spare = must-haveCan't lose 20 euros for 5 hours of gameplay (without the coming DLC) = don't buy, go watch Interstellar though.

Code Vein é um dark souls de anime, com isso já ganhou meu coração. Já deixo claro que Code Vein não é um Souls Like genérico com a ambientação pós-apocalíptica com traços de terror é única, que eu saiba.* Eu achei a gameplay bastante consistente e intuitiva, para mim que já estou familiarizado com a franquia soulsborne. Eu achei a dificuldade razoável, a pesar que teve vezes que eu passei mais dificuldades com alguns mobs do que com o próprio boss da área.* Não ocorreu nenhum bug comigo.* O jogo está bem fluido e roda no ultra a 60 FPS constante, mas as vezes da umas travada.* Algumas características, como a possibilidade de alternar e experimentar as classes, são bem-vindas para o estilo de gameplay, enquanto o inconsistente parceiro IA pode frustrar mais do que o necessário. Se você está procurando uma jogatina única no gênero que já estamos familiarizados e está disposto a viver uma relação de amor e ódio, o esforço em Code Vein vale a pena.
Um ótimo jogo, é garantido horas de jogo e uns rager de vez em quando.

Tales of Berseria e um ótimo jogo, aonde a história está conectado ao mundo do jogo anterior Tales of Zestiria, aonde a história se passa no passado distante de Tales of Zestiria, embora você não precise jogar Tales of Zestiria para entender a história de Tales of Berseria. Se você já jogou Tales of Zestiria e está preocupado com as conquistas de Tales of Berseria, não tenha medo, já que não há conquistas baseado em sorte ou conquistas de chefes relacionadas a dificuldade neste jogo. Você pode ganhar a maioria das conquistas em Tales of Berseria jogando o jogo naturalmente enquanto completando algumas quests secundárias. Além disso, existem algumas conquistas que exigem grinding, e que empurram o tempo total para o 100% para a marca de  mais de 100hrs, mas não deve haver nada muito difícil como você pode jogar em menores dificuldades e ainda ganhar as conquistas (exceto dificuldade fácil). Mas como qualquer jogo Tales of Bersaria não escapa dos bugs, alguns que não interfere na jogatina como bug do jogo ficar sem som depois que você da alt+tab(não acontece direto,e só fechar e abrir o jogo de novo que resolve), ou ficar preso em parte do mapa no meio da luta(aconteceu 3 vezes comigo). Mas o bug que me atrapalhou bastante foi o de horas não computadas em determinados títulos, pois para conseguir a conquista solid b, você precisa que todos os títulos de todos os personagens esteja no mínimo lv2, e eu já tava com quase 70hrs de jogo, e só tinha computado 10 min. no título, que precisa de 50hrs registrada para conseguir o título lv2 devota da velvet(depois que descobrir que para resolver tem que mexer na configuração gráfica).
Um ótimo jogo, com uma historia cativante. O único problema que me incomodou foi o bug que a câmera da um zoom no chão.
Melhor jogo que eu já joguei!!!!!!!
o jogo e muito divertido, com uma historia boa, a onde você e um personagem novo, o único problema para min e o multiplayer muito fraco, e eu queria que pudesse jogar a campanha com os amigo.
Jogo muito gostoso de se jogar, é um jogo pra quem tem paciência, e apesar de achar o final um pouco sem graça valeu a pena.

Графика в игре очень даже на высоком уровне. Детализация, тени, тени со светом, смена погоды - все это смотрится очень реалистично. На максимальных игра смотрится кинематографично. Если на вашей карте памяти больше гигабайта видеопамяти, в конфигураторе поставьте "Очень высокая" в опции "Размер памяти текстур". Саундтрэк - конфетка. Тут слов нет. Озвучка очень хорошая, было много возмущений по поводу голоса и внешности Геральта, я вам скажу что все очень даже хорошо и новый голос отлично гармонирует с внешностью ведьмака. Звуки в игре - бомба. Когда поют птицы, мне кажется что это на улице, когда я бежал из подземелья Ла Валлетов мне казалось что это у меня в ванной течет вода... Не буду перечислять все, но скажу что звуки реалистичны. Просто реалистичны. Боевая система непривычная и сложная. Битвы с людьми сложные, с группой - невероятно сложные. Монстров много и для каждого есть свой подход. К уровню двадцатому у игрока будет тактика для каждого из них.Сюжет в игре действительно оправдывает ожидания. Игроку интересно за каждого из персонажей, ему не хочется пропускать реплики персонажей, он хочет слышать каждое словечко из их уст. Когда ты играешь в ведьмака, ты понимаешь - здесь нет правильного и неправильного выбора, деления на зло и добро. У каждого свои принципы и убеждения, даже Лето, убийцу королей можно в чем-то понять... Кто-то прав в чем-то, а кто-то не прав. Выбор сделать очень сложно, все зависит от характера и отношения игрока к происходящему, к персонажам. Вдумавшись в сюжет, пообщавшись с персонажами поближе выбор становится пыткой. Тут нет нейтралитета, какой был в первой части. Ведьмаку Геральту нужна чья-то помощь, без нее он не справиться. Если взять в союзники Роше, Иорвет станет врагом, или наоборот... Ведьмак 2 - шедевр игровой индустрии, настоящая атмосферная ролевая игра с необычной боевой системой, взрослым продуманным сюжетом, круглыми сиськами, шикарной графикой, но в тоже время со средней оптимизацией.

本评论仅针对单机部分T组你这次真的玩过头了，我知道你们一直都很离经叛道，5代首次尝试玩家选择，不错；7代通篇脑洞剧情，但是演绎得也很不错；9代尝试双时间线，更多的玩家选择以及多结局，虽然已经有点让我不爽，但总归还在可接受范围内。于是，你们错误地认为，即使你们把COD完全乱改一气，玩家也会无底线的接受，于是，这款剧情稀烂，乱开脑洞，各种科幻到简直玄幻的设定，还有比AW更加变本加厉的技能树系统 （混乱系技能。。。。我真不是在玩无主之地2的机械术士？）的COD12，你们真的做出来了。我突然觉得CODG也许没那么烂了...9,10,11,12。未来风格的COD已经延续了四作，当初的创新如今已然食之无味，T组，如果你脑洞已经开够了的话，如果你玩得已经够开心了的话...请收手吧，把科幻未来风留给大锤，把写实未来风留给IW，你还有其他可以做的，比如，回归二战题材，毕竟，在老本上做出创新，不是更有成就感吗？

so let me make things clearThis game isnt just a trash indie game for 2 dollars or less, its a work of art for me it would do great as a mobile game but please dont make me pay or watch ads to play this game. Anyways the art style is very nice if you love the retrowave kinda style youll love this game. It also has on of the best soundtraks ever in a game thats not AAA or from big studios even though its actually better than some titels. The game makes you play through a very nice progression system with many cars of the era and if youre a car guy, some little suprises for you are in here as well. All in All would say this is a great game full support from me could only recommend it

Wolltest du dich schon immer mit wildfremden Leuten verbal prügeln? Wolltest du schon immer wissen wie viele 12 Jährige es schon mit deiner Mutter getrieben haben? Willkommen bei CS:GO! Hier lernst du russisch innerhalb weniger Wochen und mit etwas Glück auch noch 10+ Sprachen. Innerhalb weniger Spiele kann man mehr Beleidigungen auf russisch als in der Muttersprache. Wer glaubt mit Englisch in diesem Spiel etwas zu reißen, der irrt gewaltig. Konflikte werden durch Teamkills gelöst und sollte das nicht reichen, kommt noch ein "♥♥♥♥, ❤❤❤❤❤" hinterher. Sollte man im ersten Viertel des MM im Rückstand liegen, verlässt auch schon der erste Teammate das Spiel.Ok, jetzt mal ernsthaft.Mit über 1000h Spielzeit habe ich schon so einiges in diesem Spiel erlebt und etwas Erfahrung, wie ein standard MM abläuft.Teams:Wenn dann auch das letzte lustige Wesen in der letzten Sekunde "Accept" drückt werden die Teams gewählt. Diese sehen dann meist so aus:1. Du2. Russe 13. Russe 24. Russe 35. RussenkindSobald dann jeder einmal "Hallo" im Voice-Chat gesagt hat, falls dieser überhaupt benutzt wird, weiß man schon, dass man geliefert ist. Da dies ein teambasiertes Spiel ist, sehen die Osteuropäer natürlich ein, dass Englisch ein No-Go ist. Somit kann man den V-C dann schonmal deaktiviern. Mit etwas Glück hat man auch mal einen kompetenten Spieler im Team, aber sonst heißt es: Wörterbuch bereit halten.Gameplay:Da das Spiel ja sehr realistisch ist, muss natürlich auch das Gameplay dem entsprechend aufgebaut sein. Zwar ist das G-36 nicht als Waffe erhältlich, jedoch übernimmt jede andere Waffe diesen Job mit Bravour. Wenn man hinter seinem Gegner steht und sein ganzes Magazin verschießt, weil kein einziger Schuss getroffen hat, wenn man sich einen Milimeter bewegt hat, begrüßt dieser einen mit einer 180° Drehung, gefolgt von einer Ladung Blei direkt in die Fr***e.Wer dennoch damit leben kann und ein paar Mates hat mit denen er zocken kann, wird viel Spaß an diesem Spiel haben c:

Just a few lines to summarize gameplay etc. :-While Having a small backstory after each Area, you get to listen to really good music or even music from your computer.-The gameplay is really fluent, and diverses from any other roguelike due to the rythm you have to keep the pace upwith.-The Enemies have rather simple patterns that you learn when fighting against them, with each Enemytype having a unique pattern.-You can't blame anything like RNG for your mistakes, because if you die, it's because you went offbeat or memorized a pattern wrong.-The difficulty raises with each floor, showing new enemies with more complex patterns, but once you memorized them you normally can deal with them.  But, due to the beat that forces you to react instantly you have to deal with multiple patterns at once, which raises the difficulty alot in some instances. Plus, later on the difficulty gets a huge boost because of certain characters that are much more unforgiving for mistakes.-You get to choose from different charakters to play with, and each of them has a different playstyle.For example: There is a charakter that dies if he touches gold: Meaning you have to kill enemies on certain positions so that you don't block the way for yourself.All in All a great game, imo i don't even see any cons.

AudioSurf-это игра, где можно получить удовольствие от прослушивания музыки и игрового процесса. В ней вы сами решаете под какую музыку играть. Меттал, инди, рок, электроника, поп, и.т.д! Ограничений нет! В игре присутствует система рекордов и аккаунтов. Все ваши результаты сохраняются. При желании, вы можете побить рекорд другого игрока игравшего под песню которую вы поставили. В игре присутствует режим "ветеран". В данном режиме вы сможете показать свою реакцию и навыки. Если вы хотите просто по играть в удовольствие-для вас есть лёгкий режим сложности. Играя на нём приобретаются навыки и умение для игры на высоком уровне сложности. А если вы хотите по играть в кампании с другом...в игре присутствует режим на двоих!Оценка: 10 из 10! Рекомендую к покупке!

Mafia II, одна из самых моих любимых игр. Я в неё играю почти с самого начала её выхода, и она мне не надоедает.    В ней можно ощутить себя мафиозником и почувствовать атмосферу сороковых-пятидесятых годов. В ней можно делать почти всё, что можно делать в реальной жизни, а именно: покупать одежду, покупать еду, покупать оружие, мыть машины, заправлять машины, угонять машины, и многое другое. Графика в игре тоже хорошая, но на сегодняшний день-устарела. Это не беда, так как есть моды на улучшение графики.   В игре было много всего, но, часть игрового контента была вырезана по инициативам разработчиков, Это не страшно, так как в игре есть DLC, которые имеют в себе вырезанный контент из основной игры.   В целом, если не думать о старой графики, не думать о вырезанном  контенте, то игра очень интересная и может затянуть на долгое время. Рекомендую её всем.

Most disappointing game I've ever played. It's essentially taken everything bad about Saints Row the Third and made it into its own title. Boring reptitive 'quests', even story missions just feel like side quests. I kept playing this, hoping I was still just in some sort of tutorial stage, and that these missions would offer something new after some progress, but after 9 hours of gameplay, it's still just repitive missions, they've literally cut and paste missions from the Third into this game. Additionally, the map is the same, the characters are the same, the vehicles are the same, all they've done is add 'superpowers', which quite frankly aren't nearly as fun as they sound, and then called it the fourth title in their series. If you're wanting to buy a Saints Row game, buy the third one, if you've finished it, play it again - you'll still have much more fun than you will in this title.

Life is Strange is an episodic graphic adventure game, about Max, a shy mysterious girl who likes taking pictures. A normal girl at first, that is until she discovers she has an incredible power.The first episode is set in an American High School. The girl you play as, Max is only really interested in one thing: keeping her head down, and pursuing the success of her photography course. However as soon as she finds she has the ability to affect change in the time and events around her, she decides to take action. The game plays in a similar way to Telltale's graphic adventure games. You'll be put into conversations and make certain choices that effect how characters react, as well as an impact on the greater narrative. Of course, Max's ability to change time makes quite a big difference in what we would expect from these type of games. In your standard narrative game you make a choice, depending on what you believe to be the leser of two evils, but in this no matter what you choose, there's always a negative outcome for someone, regardless. Allowing you to see one of these options play out, then rewind and choose another doesn't always mean you can choose the better option, just one that will have a different chain of effect. Snooping and searching plays a big part of this game, you're able to search other's rooms, and go through a lot of their stuff, most of the time this snooping is purely optional and not part of the puzzle solving - but you get a much richer narrative picture when you take the time to hunt down all those little details.Finding out about all of the characters is very interesting, and deciding which of those characters to help - then considering how the choices you make will effect them, and whether or not to put yourself first. That said, the rewind mechanical as a way to solve puzzles is interesting, however sometimes you'll hit a point where you need to choose a different dialogue option by anticipating what you know the character wants to hear, because you just heard them say that, which isn't particularly challenging, however the rewind system can also remove the stress that would play a good role in some of the scenes. When trying to find a hiding spot in Max's friends bedroom, it creates a tense moment as you struggle to find someone to hide before her stepfather comes in. However due to the rewind feature it means you can constantly rewind, until you find a spot to hide in. The feature in this scene removed the stress, and took from what could have been a really intense scene. Once you've finished they show the percentages of other player's decisions against yours, this is a nice feature, and can make you contemplate the choices you've made - long after you've chosen them. The game has a great story, deep and well-fleshed characters and some of the most beautiful cutscenes. Detail has been lovingly put into the environment, and creates a mysterious, and wonderful games. It'll be interesting to see what the other episodes have to offer. This is definitely one of the best games I've ever played.

Terraria is an indie game for PC, console, and mobile devices. It was one of the first game to be inspired by Minecraft. As in Minecraft, you explore a randomly-generated world of blocks. Monsters lurk around every corner, and the only way to get ahead is by crafting more powerful items. You can explore alone or with friends, and in the course of play you'll discover a strange fantasy world of peril and wonder. This does make for a much simpler game world. But it also serves to streamline a lot of the frustrating aspects of Minecraft. One of the most stressful things about Minecraft is the way that monsters can sneak up on you, as you have a first person veiw. With flat, 2D graphics, you can see all of your enemies out to get you at a glance. One thing I also enjoyed is that items don't wear out. Although I haven't played much Minecraft myself, things wearing out after you've spent hours finding resources to craft them, doesn't sound so fun. You're even given some tools right at the beginning to start off with.Crafting options appear automatically when you have the necessary resources. When you first start out, there's a NPC standing next you who serves a guide. Talk to him, and he'll give you some basic instructions to get started. They don't expect you to trawl the wiki just to figure out what's going on. You can build houses, and fit them out with chairs, tables, and other accessories. Expanding your home is a big requirement for progression,  If you build extra rooms on your house, NPCs will spawn, selling items, and helping you along your journey.The more you progress, the tougher enemies become. The only way to cope with these ever-increasing threats is by upgrading all your gear, and it's this challenge that makes up most of the game. Your doesn't wear out, but there are so many weapon classes, and there's always just one more upgrade to buy. The world and enemies are amazing, you really do feel compelled to explore. There are so many different treasures and surprises to find.In Minecraft, and other games similar, you often reach a point where you run out things to do. Terraria fixes that problem by including bigger and bigger enemies, and more and more cool weapons to take them down. I loved how there are so many items and weapon classes, even if some of them are a bit useless. You feel like you're exploring a real place, and figuring out how everything works in this world is part of the charm. I'm not sure if I have the patience to keep burrowing until I'm crafting my own laser guns, however this game will keep you entertained for hours. The game is decently priced, and often goes on sale. With how much you get with this game, such as Steam Trading cards, Steam achievments, (Also the option to save worlds & characters to the Steam Cloud), this game offers many enjoyable hours of single player, co-op and multiplayer, and is definitely deserving a 9/10.

Counter Strike is one of the most important shooters out there, for what it brought to FPS and what it has done for competitive gaming scene. But it has been long overdue for an update since CS:S, which brings us to Counter Strike Global Offensive.Being accused of hacking is the best compliment a CS player can have. This is a solid update to Counter Strike, they haven't changed too much which was the biggest fear. In fact, it's more of an update of old Counter Strike, as opposed to an update of Source. Firstly, everything is more shiny, and the maps are much more detailed. There's motion blur and AA up the wazzo. The sound design is also masterfully updated so that all the guns sound the same, but a better version of them. The controls don't feel as floaty as old CS, it's all a bit tighter, the models updates look great as well.While I was happy that there is a heavier focus on chickens now, with a higher density of them, and there are better animations of them. Although the chicken AI is terrible, I saw a couple walk into the flames.All the menus, quick match and server browser functions work well. The menus and HUD have all had an overhaul too, I like that you can see the icons of who is left in your team up the top and how much health they have. I like that catching someone by surprise isn't a guaranteed kill, they still have time to whip around and fire a few shots off. The new molotov's are also very useful in bottle necks although the effect isn't that pretty, which goes for the grenades as well, it's certainly stressful begin caught in the flames. There's also a taser now, which is useless but hilarious if you get kill.  There's nothing more frustrating than a standoff while everyone else waits, or a dirty AFKer. Along with the standard CS modes, there are also 2 new official ones. Arms race which is a gun game that gives you a new weapon with each kill. The final knife wins the match! I enjoy arms race more than I thought I would Bajo, there's something so stressful when someone is down to the knife, trying to get that final kill to win the game. There's also this rewarding 'bung' sound when you take out an enemy, which also lets you know you have a new gun full of ammo, you can really get a rhythm going. The other official mode is Demolition which is a mish mash of gun game and bomb defusal. One team needs to plant a bomb and every kill progresses your weapon to the next one for the next round. This is a pretty masterful, updated, it's not as visually amazing as some other shooters, but I'm kind of glad that it's also very much the same game. So I'm giving it 9/10.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iGDBTDnW7d0Star Wars: The Old Republic is prehaps one of the best Star Wars games on the market at the moment. Coming in with 8 class stories where you either protect the citizens of the Galactic Republic as a vaillant Jedi Knight or rain torrents of death and destruction them as an agent of the Empire is all up to  you as you make major decisions throughout which could impact and shape the fate of the entire galaxy.The game features plenty of planets to visit, many of them rich in content and lore to unravel as you progress through your character's class story. From the idyllic temples of the Jedi Order on Tython to the dark and gloomy heights of the Sith Empire's homeworld, Dromund Kaas. You also get to meet plenty of characters who will either support you in your quest or secretly conspire against you, which makes room for some pretty intense moments at certain points, which is why i really recommend the Imperial Agent storyline for newcomers :PDownside is that the game can feel pretty limited when you're not subscribed as some major features are locked until you finally do. Subscribers gain access to all current expansion packs and get a monthly 500 Cartel Coins which they can use to buy awesome cosmetics in the Cartel Market. You can also get 100 CC a month once you have attached a security key to your account too.The gameplay and graphics can feel somewhat dated at times, but the awesome storyline and active community really make up for it. There are plenty of guilds you can join where you can meet awesome new folks and tackle on the many flashpoints and operations which can net you awesome gear and plenty of credits too.SWTOR: 8/10

I don't know if it's just me, but every time I rev my diesel engines and see dark fumes come out the exhaust pipes, I swear I can hear a faint voice saying: "how dare you!"... The bigger and older the truck, the louder the voice gets, interesting...

Only buy, if you want to play it solo, even then, be prepared to deal with a trailer full of bugs, like tools not detaching from tractor, saying "Detach while folding not allowed" even when there's no foldable object on your tractor, like a counter weight, etc., forks from forklifts getting stuck in the ground and more... Also the overall sound of the game is too silent, sometimes I can barely hear the engines, but these are things I could live with until they are fixed, but what really pissed me off is the multiplayer, which DOES NOT WORK! Every time I try to join a dedicated server (which my brother rented and  payed  for), it's like a casino slot-machine, I either hit the jackpot or I don't, meaning, the server does not appear in the list, or when it does, there's a 50/50 chance I cannot connect because F knows for what reason... I loved FS19, I even bought a Saitek Heavy Machinery side panel specifically for this game, but so far FS22 is a big heap of manure! Hopefully a fix is on its way, but until then thumbs down from me.

Sh*ttiest online experience ever! I've tried to give it time, I've played this game on and off for years, but instead of getting better, it got worse. It's basically a Pay-2-Win game. You can try putting in the time and grind for everything if you want to, but you'll soon realize, the game just wasn't designed to favor the grindy type players as the harassment of "rich players" ( sharkcards ) and hackers will have you constantly skip sessions, until you lose interest in the game and go play something else.

I really wish Steam would have a "meh" button for such occasions, cuz I really enjoyed the game at the beginning, but it has become very tedious to keep up with everything (save me the "you know you can close the gas station when things get out of hand" I know, but then you don't make money), I mean, where on earth do you have to call your employees to work every single day, if I'd do that with my employer, I would probably get fired the next day, not to mention their wage is a bit high, they earn around 100$/8h shift and you have to pay them daily, otherwise you cannot even call them to work! I would like to have the option to negotiate their wage when I hire them and have them ask for a raise over time when they get better at a certain job, so I can decide to pay them more or let them go, this would also add a little more depth to the game. Just add a "schedule work-shift" option and at least a weekly payment method or make it automatic for the time being, so I don't have to worry about paying them/calling them to work every day! Overall it's a promising game, it just needs a little rework here and there, some bug fixes and I will recommend this game once I see some changes for the above mentioned issues! Btw. the amount of dust footsteps and garbage my customers still bring in, even after the update, just makes me wanna chase them out with the broomstick.

Do I recommend the story mode of this game? Yes, most definitely! Do I recommend the online mode? As it is right now, not in a 100 years! Why? Well, apart from the modders that blow people up and make it look like it was you, this game is a buggy mess, missions not registering after you complete them, challenges not registering after doing everything it asked you to do, for example, complete a bounty hunt with one other posse member, I did it 3 times and it still didn't register, or complete a bounty hunt without killing anyone, I did that too, twice and still nothing! You have to collect 5 bird eggs? Well, good luck with that too, cuz when you find the egg in a nest up on a tree, you have to shoot the nest with a varmint rifle, to make the egg fall off, but it doesn't, it gets stuck on the tree, with no way for you to be able to reach it and collect it and this happens almost every time, 1 out of the 3 eggs that your map shows you, will get stuck, which will leave you with no other choice but to "abandon" the map and go buy another one! Resupply missions... they're all good, when they work properly, you do what you have to, get the supplies in time, but then the game decides that "f*ck you I won't register it as a mission complete", cuz why should it, it only took 11-12 minutes out of your time to do it, so go do it again instead of doing something else that will eventually bug out on you as well, like for example the custom outfits that you've put together for your character, they will just get deleted and leave you with one single custom outfit that you had when you last exited the game, which is not a big deal, unless you travel a lot between different climates, then it becomes an issue and these are only a few that I've mentioned, the list could go on! There are not a lot of things you can do in RDO, but the ones you can do, will often make you feel that you're just wasting your time because of these bugs and I believe that a company as big as R* could fix these issues if they really wanted to, but they are too busy milking the hell out of GTAO!

As much as I'd love to recommend this game,I can't!The only way to enjoy ARK is when you play it solo,even then,you might find it boring after a while. Joining a dedicated server:Oh boy,where should I start... so,when you pick a spawn point,you hope you won't spawn in someone's building,or you might get stuck there until someone/something kills you,or you die from thirst/starvation. Okay,let's say by some miracle,you managed to not get stuck in a building,you start minding your own business doing what needs to be done to not meet an early demise,you start to get hungry,you have some raw meat and you want to cook it... now this is where the "fun" starts: you want to place your campfire to cook the meat... SURPRISE!!! you can't,all along the coastline there are player-built pillars to prevent you from building anything in the area,you need to go further inland to find a suitable spot that's not already "occupied" and risk getting eaten by a pack of raptors,or a hungry carno (which by the way is almost inevitable),so your only chance for survival is to join a faction and become their "do-it-all". Hosting your own game session:Let's say you're more like me and want a little bit of peace and quiet to enjoy the game with a friend or two,so you host a game and start your adventure only to find out that your friends get dragged after you wherever you go,because you're the host and they need to be close to you at all times. I need not say how annoying that gets after a while,let's say you get attacked by something and need to get the F out of there,unless you are all running in the same direction,the one that ran the opposite direction will be dragged into danger and get killed,also if you,the host,die,wherever you re-spawn,your friends will be teleported to you immediately. (Note: I do understand why the tethering system is necessary,otherwise my computer would crap itself from the strain the game produces rendering the world for each player in part,but at least put the slider back so we can adjust the tethering distance) In conclusion,you either rent a server to enjoy ARK with your friends,or you play it solo,otherwise,it's just a waste of money.

Рекомендованные требования это полное дерьмо. На 8700к и 1080 на ультрах в  FHD 45 фпс на улице, выключал тени, снижал все, что можно с тенями, результата 0, Переносов куча, а толку нет. Игру ждал, но она обосралась по оптимизону, дальше будет видно.Игра стоит на SSD, рваная картинка, и фризы ухудшают ситуацию, да и мыло какое-то, а не графика.1080 конечно не топ карта, но ожидал хотя-бы стабильные 60 кадров на высоких-ультра
В 2007 бесила эта курва Мартинес,которая обгоняла всех и вся.В 2020 бесит эта курва Мартинес, которая до сих пор обгоняет всех и вся.

Я как фанат вселенной ксеноморфов, не мог не написать своё мнение про игру. В игре присуствует очень красивая графика,для 2014 года,и идет почти на каждом ведре(впервые играл пиратку на gtx 650 на высоких настройках,с выключеными фишками)Видно что Creative Assembly позаботилсь не только о своём кармане,а ещё и об игроках(Привет нынешним новинкам,конкретно кому не скажу,ибо не оскорблять)И так,старт игры  мне показался довольно простым,без лишних деталей,так сказать то что доктор прописал.Бегал в начале по Севастополю в поисках пасхалок,и различных бонусов,но их не так много,но одна мне показалась очень,и очень классной,многие сразу поймут о чём я,а именно,о моменте когда мы играем за Марлоу,и попадаем на корабль пришельцев(Да-да именно тот, что мы видели в  фильме 1979 года)Почти точная копия момента из фильма,ну просто сверх крутость,приятно что добавили такой "кусочек фильма" в игру.А теперь кратко о  "жильцах" а конкретно о ксеноморфе,или как его называют "чужой"На своих собратьев из серии Aliens vs. Predator или Colonial Marines он совсем не похож.Местами он настолько "слепой",что не видит того,что вы стоите просто у него перед носом,он просто проходит мимо,и уничтожает тех,кто создает какой либо шум,но сранных андроидов он не трогает,а бывает что вытаскивает вас просто со шкафа, и всаживает вам в голову частичку "себя".Если вы спрятались под стол,не думайте что вы в безапасности,стоит ему только задеть вас кончиком хвоста,он тут же вытащит вас из под стола(не думал что даже такое разработчики продумают).Шумы в вентиляции и постоянные преследование Рипли очень поднимало интерес к игре,но потом это перерастает а банальное "♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ иди убей кого-то другого" или же "как же ты меня достал,иди поищи кого-то другого)Следующие жильцы этого корабля это андроиды,настолько примитивные создания,что иногда просто удивляюсь,накой хрен этот андроид тут нужен,эти примитивные андроиды слоняются из комнаты в комнату, просто от нечего делать, после прохождения "н" количества игры,понимаешь что они играют важную роль.Пробегая в страхе от ксеноморфа часто слышишь «Вам чем-нибудь помочь? Рассказать правила безопасности на станции?»В агрессии они просто ужасны,бегают за тобой с словами «Я хочу вам помочь»Но нет,они хотят вас убить.Ничего особенного про них не могу сказать,обычные роботы,что с них взять?)Третьи жильцы корабля это выжившие,они настолько глупы,чтобы при виде вас начинают стрелять своими пукалками,привлекая нашего другого "жильца"а он то свою работу знает))Ну как же тут не вспомнить нашего друга Уэйтса,который сидит в своем бункере и только командует.Alies Isolation явно поиграет на ваших нервах,играйте желательно в наушиках,так будет приятней вам.Итак мои оценки:Сюжет 9/10.Геймплей 9/10.Звуки,Музыка и Озвучка 10/10.Визуальный ряд 10/10.

Игра, как заметили многие игроки, просто шедевральна.Сюжет просто 10из 10,играть за Цири просто одно удовольствие)Со старта игры не разобрался со всеми кнопками и знаками,но со временем всё привыкается,и делается уже на автомате)Графика игры довольно красивая,даже не смотря что игре уже несколько лет,конкурирует с многими новинками 2018 года.Музыка во время боя очень понравилась,но со временем надоедает.Боевая система мне по вкусу.Купил Ведьмака с двумя DLC.Кровь и Вино показалось каким-то нудным,да и рисовка окружения мыльная,по сравнению с оригиналом,После Туссента забегай в Новиград глаз просто радовался.Дополнение Каменные серца понравилось,не слишком большое,не затянутое,проходится на одном дыхании.Из минусов можно отметить то что в игре много клонов,бегая по локации встречаешь одну и ту же  физиономию,что дико бесило по прохождению игры(хотя потом уже не обращаешь на это внимание)Но Лицо Йеннифэр,Трисс и Цири уникально,и больше его нигде не увидишь,не смотря на то,что во втором ведьмаке была проститука с лицом Трисс(Сам я этого не заметил,мне подсказали).Проходил игру около 70 часов,делая сперва второстепенные квесты,а потом  основные,дабы насладиться игрой.Иногда пытаясь выбрать меньшее зло,приходиться жертвовать людьми(Привет Кровавому Барону,и Кейре Мец)Игра получилась очень захватывающей,и интересной,однозначно 10/10.
