Seventh Lair is a kinetic visual novel developed by NOVECT and published by MangaGamer and WhisperGames.  It is a spin-off game to The House in Fata Morgana, so there are character references from that game, although it isn't necessary to have played it before diving into this.  (However, I do recommend playing The House in Fata Morgana first before playing Seventh Lair.)  You take on the role of Dark†Knight, a 27 year old indie game developer who's been struggling with his career.  Despite the criticisms and such that he receives on his website, "Royaume Heaven," Dark†Knight (whose real name is Michel) continues to create games with his passion and vision in mind, even if they don't sell well.  However, things are quiet on the game development front until one of the forum users trolls him to create a new game.  From that, Michel responds that there will be a new game on April Fool's Day.  The game, as you might have guessed, is called "Seventh Lair".  However, anyone who downloads the game ends up being transported into that game world, which turns out to be a RPG.  Unknowingly, Michel ends up being transported and is the "hero" of the game.  Now, he and his companions (the others who downloaded the game) have to figure out a way to return to the real world.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.In regards to gameplay, like The House in Fata Morgana and The House in Fata Morgana: A Requiem for Innocence, Seventh Lair has a linear story, so you just play through the story from beginning to end.  It alternates between the game world and Michel's past although the two of them eventually merge together.  There's no voice acting (although that has never been the case for any of the developer's VNs) and no CG gallery.  However, there are the usual Steam achievements as well as a music gallery that is unlocked after you finish the main story.  Also, a side story (call it a prequel to the events of Seventh Lair) is unlocked.Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  I became a fan of The House in Fata Morgana after hearing such praise about it, so when I heard about Seventh Lair coming to Steam, I was excited to get around to playing it.  (Thanks to an awesome friend, I was able to get this game. ^^)  First, regarding the story, I found it fun and different from the developer's other VNs.  Although there are characters from The House in Fata Morgana and a character from A Requiem for Innocence, the characters' personalities in Seventh Lair are quite different from their counterparts.  (Well, for the most part. XD)  The story starts off a bit slow, with Michel and the others trying to figure out what's going on.  However, it picks up when certain past events and circumstances are revealed, which led to the characters being in their current predicament.  I especially liked how events unfolded towards the end when it gets revealed what Michel's actual involvement is.  As for the writing, the pacing is fine once the beginning picks up and all.  I liked the back and forth between the game world and the narration of Michel's past.  I noticed several typos and such, so I feel like the writing could use another proofreading pass, but they aren't distracting to the point that the story isn't enjoyable.As for the art, the style is the same as in The House in Fata Morgana and A Requiem for Innocence.  It is as beautiful as ever, and although the sprites are the same and some of the backgrounds are, too, there are new backgrounds as well.  They're mostly present to help narrate Michel's past.  Finally, in regards to the soundtrack, there are new tracks present.  They definitely have the same vibe from The House in Fata Morgana VNs as well as capture the moods and emotions well.  I especially enjoyed listening to the vocals, and the song from "The Fairy House" was beautiful and touching.Overall, would I recommend Seventh Lair?  If you like VNs and especially like The House in Fata Morgana, this is certainly worth a look.  At first, Seventh Lair appears to be more like a fun spin-off, but upon delving into the story, I found that it has a much deeper emotional one.  You may end up needing tissues by the end of this story.  For the asking price, I'd say it's worth getting although you can wait to get it on a sale.  However, it's definitely worth adding to a VN enthusiast's Steam library. ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

Ballads at Midnight is a visual novel developed by Synstoria and published by Abiding Bridge.  You take on the role of Abigail (whose name can be changed), a traveling bard who is sentenced to exile (for tyranny against the crown) to an old estate, where there are rumors of a vampire that takes the exiled as his victims.  When Abigail meets the vampire, Lucius, though, he isn't what she expected.  Lucius doesn't take Abigail as his victim although he tells her that she's going to have to earn her freedom.  At first, the two of them don't trust each other, but as they get to know one another, they slowly become friends and then perhaps something even more.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.As for the gameplay, Ballads at Midnight has multiple endings, so there are choices presented throughout the story that determine which ending you get.  The endings range from Abigail earning her freedom to Abigail and Lucius becoming romantically involved and the choice to turn Abigail into a vampire.  There are no CGs although there are Steam achievements as well as some original tracks and partial English voice acting.Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  I found the store page description for this visual novel to be intriguing, so I figured I should give it a go.  XD  In regards to the story, I found it catching from the start.  Here, we have Abigail, being dragged by two escort guards to be exiled and supposedly sacrificed.  Right away, it's obvious that Abigail is sarcastic and quick witted, based on the way that she addresses the guards.  Although it's a mystery as to the specific details that led to her punishment, we find out later on why (and it's quite a doozy).  I enjoyed reading the story and how things progress between Abigail and Lucius, who turns out to simply be bored rather than bloodthirsty.  lol  Witnessing the growing relationship between the two was great, and I liked how Abigail and Lucius end up understanding one another.  As for the writing, I found it fairly well paced, and I didn't notice any typos.  I thought the choices presented were appropriate and spaced out well.  As for achievements, I didn't have any issue getting all of them, especially if you use a walkthrough.  (There are a couple of obscure ones, so a walkthrough might be needed.)  In regards to the art, I liked the style used.  It's a departure from the typical anime style used in a lot of VNs, and I thought that the backgrounds especially looked beautiful.  The colors are muted and never overly bright, which is appropriate for the tone of this story.  I wish there were a few CGs, but seeing that this was created during NaNoReNo, there's only a limited amount of time, so I can understand there not being any.  Finally, as to the soundtrack, there are a few tracks, but the ones present fit the mood of the story very well.  Also, there are even a couple of original vocal tracks, which are pleasant to listen to.Overall, would I recommend Ballads at Midnight?  If you enjoy visual novels and are looking for an intriguing, not too dark story that'll take a few hours to get all the endings, then I'd say this is worth taking a look.  I liked the story a lot, and each ending was great in its own way.  There is no true ending (at least, that's what I think), so all the endings are satisfactory.  Also, it's a free VN, so it's totally worth checking out.  ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

Higurashi When They Cry Hou - Rei is a kinetic visual novel developed by 07th Expansion and published by MangaGamer.  It consists of three stories (a.k.a. chapters): Saikoroshi, Hirukowashi, and Batsukoishi.  These chapters are a collection for the fan disc of the Higurashi series.  Saikoroshi is a short chapter that occurs after the events of Matsuribayashi, while Hirukowashi and Batsukoishi serve as comedical short side stories that aren't canon to the series.  In addition, there are both the Higurashi after party and staff room scenes that are unlocked once you complete the three chapters.  It is highly recommended that you read the previous Higurashi chapters (especially Matsuribayashi) before diving into this fan disc.  As for the gameplay, Higurashi When They Cry Hou - Rei is both a kinetic and sound novel.  Thus, there are no choices presented as you play through the chapters.  Also, it is called a sound novel since the series relies on "sound" for the reader to fully immerse and enjoy themselves while reading these stories.  As usual, you can choose either to use Ryukishi's original sprites or MangaGamer's updates ones, and Steam achievements are present.Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  I've enjoyed the Higurashi series ever since I read the first chapter, Onikakushi.  (Shameless plug, but Onikakushi is free for those who are curious about this series. XD)  Even though Matsuribayashi was a great way to wrap up the main story, I'm happy that Ryukishi wrote up these extra chapters for Rei.  I liked how in Saikoroshi, we get to see what happens when after Rika's bicycling accident, she gets transported to an alternate Hinamizawa, where the tragedies that are depicted throughout the series never happen.  However, not all is as it seems.  Especially, I liked getting to witness the aftermath and a certain discussion that's made about fate and such, which has been a recurring theme throughout the series.  Hirukowashi is a hilarious side story, where there's talk about the fabled Magatama made by the god Hanyuu and how Rena accidentally swallows one of the two items and the antics that ensue.  There's quite a bit of fourth wall breaking and references to events from previous chapters.  Finally, Batsukoishi is a funny side story that talks about how Keiichi continually loses at the club's games and must endure its punishments.  He wishes to turn things around, and that's when the hilarious fantasies (which border of the lewd side when it comes to describing scnes) ensue.  I found all of these chapters, as well as the after party and staff chat, very enjoyable to read and a wonderful way to conclude the Higurashi series.  Honestly, I can't find anything to criticize about them although again, I do recommend reading the previous chapters in order not to be spoiled.As for the writing, it's well-paced and I didn't find any typos.  The chapters are on the short side, compared to previous Higurashi series.  Even Himatsubushi is longer.  However, since this is a fan disk, it's understandable.  As for the art, the backgrounds are the same as in the previous chapters, but they do give off that feeling of being in the Japanese countryside in the small village of Hinamizawa.  As I mentioned earlier, you can choose to use either Ryukishi's sprites or MangaGamer's ones.  Personally, I prefer MangaGamer's sprites although both have their own charm.  MangaGamer's sprites are in the typical anime style, while Ryukishi's sprites have that moe feel.  Finally, the soundtrack is pretty much the same as in the previous chapters although there are a couple of new tracks in Hirukowashi.  There's a good variety, and I like how each track fits with the mood of the scene it's placed in, which can vary from happy-go-lucky to horror.Overall, would I recommend Higurashi When They Cry Hou - Rei?  If you like visual novels and are especially a fan of the Higurashi series, there's no doubt in my mind that you should pick this up.  It's a great read and a wonderful way to conclude the series.  I'll miss this series and the wonderful characters, but Ryukishi has written other stories, such as Umineko (although I've already read all of that series).  I hope that more of Ryukishi's stories will come to Steam, and I just want to say a huge thanks to 07th Expansion for all their hard work in localizing this series and MangaGamer in bringing it here.  ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

All the Words She Wrote is a kinetic yuri visual novel developed and published by ebi-hime.  You take on the role of Mayo Takaoka, a 24-year old woman who drifts between jobs, not having any particular goal or future plans, and she doesn't feel motivated to work towards anything.  Mayo isn't particularly intelligent (she even admits this as much to herself), but she has a very bubbly and kind personality.  However, Mayo does have a certain love for Elf Forest, a popular light novel series, and she considers the author, Rui Tsuchimi, to be her idol.  As Mayo is working at her part-time bakery job, her aunt Sae (who works at a publishing company that publishes Elf Forest) enters and after a bit of conversation and so forth, Sae offers her a job opportunity.  Rui Tsuchimi is in need of a housekeeper to take care of daily chores and cooking, and Sae thinks that Mayo would be a great fit for the job.  Being Tsuchimi's fan, Mayo happily accepts.  However, upon arriving at her idol's home, having previously learned from Sae the author's real name (since Rui Tsuchimi is a pseudonym), Mayo discovers that Hijiri Komikado (the real name of the author of Elf Forest) has a prickly personality, keeping people at a distance.  Also, it turns out that Hijiri really dislikes Elf Forest, which baffles Mayo for a long time.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.As for the gameplay, All the Words She Wrote is a linear visual novel, so there are no choices present.  You just progress through the story from beginning to end.  There are several CGs (and you can view unlocked CGs in the Gallery on the Main Menu) as well as Steam achievements (although the achievements won't count towards a user's global total since the game is in "profile features limited").  Also, once you complete the story, you'll get access to the author's notes, explaining the inspiration behind the story.Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  I've enjoyed many of ebi-hime's VNs, and this one is no exception.  I was in the mood to pick up a light-hearted romance, and All the Words She Wrote definitely has that (albeit with a couple of dramatic moments).  First, as to the story, I enjoyed it overall.  I liked getting to follow Mayo as she's introduced and I got to learn about her family life, in particular about her mother nagging her to have some direction in life.  In a way, I can relate to Mayo (although I think I had much more direction than Mayo did at that age lol).  The story is mostly light-hearted and comedical although, as I mentioned, it has a couple of dramatic moments.  They mostly occur towards the way latter part of the story.  I liked how Hijiri is introduced and how things are initially awkward between Mayo and Hijiri.  The two of them slowly open up although there are a couple of bumps along the road.  I enjoyed how the story wraps up, but I won't spoil it here.  As for the characters, I found them to be enjoyable.  Mayo is perhaps a bit too bubbly and maybe idiotic to my liking, but I think Hijiri more than makes up for it with her aloof personality.  lol  There's a nice cast of characters with varying personalities although the story is mostly focused on Mayo and Hijiri, with Sae appearing on occasion.As for the writing, I found it pretty well-paced, as I find that to be the case for all of ebi-hime's kinetic VNs.  I noticed some typos, and although they weren't enough to make me enjoy the story any less, it couldn't hurt to have another proofreading pass.  In regards to the art, it's in the typical anime style, and I absolutely love that about some of ebi-hime's VNs.  Since the story is light-hearted, having an anime style suits it better.  However, it's kind of hard to imagine at times that Mayo is actually 24 years old while Hijiri is 28 years old.  lol  Finally, as to the music, I enjoyed listening to the various tracks.  There's a good range in regards to the varying moods in the story, and each track fit in well where it was placed.Overall, would I recommend All the Words She Wrote?  If you like ebi-hime's VNs and are in the mood for a light-hearted yuri romance, I totally recommend giving this a try.  I found the story enjoyable, and I liked getting to see the blossoming relationship between Mayo and Hijiri.  It is on the short side, but to be fair, all of ebi-hime's kinetic VNs (the ones I've gotten to play) tend to be short.  It's a good way to pass away a few hours, but I would recommend holding off for a bit of a sale.  It is in a couple of Steam bundles, though, so if you already have the other games in those bundles, you can save quite a bit.  ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

fault - StP - LIGHTKRAVTE is a kinetic visual novel developed by ALICE IN DISSONANCE and published by Phoenixx Inc.  For those who are familiar with the fault - milestone series, this latest entry is the prequel to it.  You don't need to have played the previous games in order to enjoy this story.  Anyway, you take on the role of Khaji Oberg, an ordinary citizen in the kingdom of Rughzenhaide.  Khaji is the son of the owner of Oberg Fruit Farm, which is highly renowned for its delicious fruits.  Although the citizens expect Khaji to take over the fruit farm, Khaji's dream is to become a painter.  Although he practices hard to reach his dream, his skills don't improve.  Later, Khaji learns why that may be the case, and this revelation forces Khaji to look within himself and ask whether he can ever truly become a painter.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.As for the gameplay, fault - StP - LIGHTKRAVTE is a kinetic novel, so it has a linear story and no choices are presented.  You just play through the story from beginning to end.  A major change I noticed from the previous fault novels is that in this one, the sprites are animated.  There are several CGs shown as well although unfortunately, no CG gallery from which to view unlocked CGs.  There's no voice acting although it has never been present in any of the games in the series.  However, there is an encyclopedia which explains all the terminology that's present (and there's quite a lot).  The usual Steam achievements and trading cards are present.Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  For those who've read my reviews of fault - milestone one and fault - milestone two side:above, it is no secret that I'm a huge fan of the series.  Imagine my excitement when I found out that the devs finally had a new fault story ready (although I'll be really excited when the next game in the fault - milestone series is out).  In regards to the story, I like that it takes place years before the events of fault - milestone one.  Although the main characters from that game, Princess Selphine and her future guardian Ritona, make appearances, they serve more as minor characters.  The main character is Khaji.  The story itself starts off kind of slow, and Khaji can come off as a dolt.  He wants to become a painter because he wishes to preserve the image of one of his friends, Flora, in a certain light.  However, Khaji is presented with obstacles, and they're discouraging him from becoming a painter.  However, he won't give up his dream of preserving Flora's image, so as you may guess, he might find another way.  I don't wish to give away too many story spoilers since this is a linear novel and all that.  I like how the story does pick up later on, especially towards a certain event that occurs pretty late.  However, the story wraps up really nicely, and I love that cinematic feel at the end.  It makes you feel like you're not just reading a story.  You're getting to experience the events and the characters' emotions.  There's a wide variety of characters, and I enjoyed getting to see Selphine and Ritona again.  They maintain their personalities from the previous games, and I found it especially interesting to learn about Ritona's life before she became Selphine's guardian.  Most of the characters are new ones not in previous games in the series, so it's a refreshing change, and you definitely don't need to have played the other games to enjoy this one.As for the writing, I already mentioned my main points with it.  The only thing I will add is that I found it fairly well-paced, and it has a good balance of humor, drama, and adventure.  I didn't notice any typos as well.  In regards to the art, it is gorgeous.  It's definitely a step up from the art in the previous games.  As I mentioned earlier, the sprites are animated, so they give off that live action feel.  However, the art itself is still very much in the anime style.  The backgrounds are very well done, and I especially liked viewing the CGs.  I just wish there was a CG gallery where we can view them (and to take screenshots as well).  Finally, regarding the music, the tracks used are beautiful and full of variety.  There are several of them, and each one felt very appropriately placed.  Sound effects are present, too, although voice acting is absent.  I think it would have been nice for voice acting to be an option since it would really give the animated sprites life.  However, the story is well presented without it.Overall, would I recommend fault - StP - LIGHTKRAVTE?  If you're a fan of the fault - milestone series and/or just enjoy visual novels in general, I recommend giving this a try.  Despite it being a prequel, you really don't need to have played the other games to enjoy this one.  In regards to price, I might recommend to hold off for a bit of a sale since it took me about 7.5 hours to finish the story.  As I'm a slow reader, it may take faster readers much less time.  However, it's worth getting, and I'm hoping that the developers will have the next installment in the fault - milestone series ready sometime soon.  Also, I'd love more stories in the fault - STP series.  ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

Gilded Shadows is an otome, sci-fi visual novel developed and published by Steamberry Studio.  You take on the role of Morgan Leone (whose name, personality traits, and facial looks are customizable), a typical university student living in New Albion (on the planet Arcalis), pursuing studies in archaeology.  Some humans on the planet have ESP, and thus, they are called Espers.  Of course, among them, some humans have stronger abilities than others.  Morgan is an Esper although she has chosen to hide the fact that she has abilities, for fear that being discovered will alter what she wishes to do with her life, which is to pursue archaeology.  However, after an incident between her and an unregistered Esper, Morgan finds herself being kidnapped and pursued by different factions, as it's discovered that she is an Esper.  Not only is she an Esper, it turns out that she's a queen-ranked one, which is one of the most powerful Espers.  These factions all want to recruit and use Morgan for her abilities.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.As for the gameplay, Gilded Shadows has multiple routes.  At the time of this review, six romance routes are available, with three additional routes that will be released as they are ready.  Each route has a few endings, depending on the choices made.  There are both passionate (best) and sweet (second best) endings as well as, at least, one bad ending.  At the start of the game, you can choose to customize Morgan's appearance with hair color, eye color, etc., as well as choose her personality traits (i.e. emotional vs. analytical) and give her an entirely different name, if you wish.  There are several CGs in each route as well as a flowchart to keep track of the choices made throughout the route, biographies of the romance routes and Morgan, and a glossary to keep track of all the terminology that's presented throughout the story.  In addition, there are Steam achievements although at the time of this review, they won't count towards a user's global total until the game is out of "Steam is learning about this game".Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique. Ever since I first heard of the development of this visual novel, I've been keeping track of it, so I was totally excited when I learned that it was released on Steam.  First, the story captured my interest.  Right off the bat, Morgan is in a dangerous situation, which makes one wonder how she got herself caught up in it in the first place.  Then, we, as the reader, learn about the previous day's events and everything that leads up to the present.  The first few chapters are the common route, and depending on the choices made, Morgan will either end up on the Crimson path (with Jack or Caissa as possible love interests), Endgame path (with Ari, Caleb, or Magnus as love interests), or on an entirely independent path (with Lance as the sole romance interest).  There is a recommended order in regards to routes, and I do highly suggest to follow it.  In regards to the story itself, I found it to have its exciting, suspenseful moments as well as the slower, more romantic ones.  I enjoyed getting to read each route, and I found myself liking all of them, which is rare since in visual novels with multiple routes, there tends to be one or two routes that I don't like very much.  However, that wasn't the case here.  I found all the romance options with their varying personalities to be likable, and each has his own story.  Also, I liked how in each route, there are numerous NPCs to add to the interaction with Morgan and the romance interest.  BTW, Lance is definitely the best route, with the most spoiler reveals, so it's best to save him for last. In regards to the writing, I found it pretty well-paced.  In the common route, there are a total of four chapters, and in the individual romance route, there are a total of fourteen chapters (unless you end up getting one of the bad endings).  There's a good balance of exciting events as well as slower romance ones, and I found the romance scenes to be well-written.  They can get steamy, which is somewhat reflected in certain CGs.  However, there's an option to disable the full-on love scenes and switch them to "fade-to-black".  I noticed a few typos, but they aren't distracting to the point where the story becomes unenjoyable.As for the art, it is gorgeous.  I love the style that the artist uses, which gives off that more realistic feel.  It differs from the anime style that's typically used in a lot of VNs, so it's a nice change of pace.  The backgrounds and sprites are well done, and the CGs especially are beautiful to view.  Colors felt well-balanced, never once seeming too bright.  In regards to the soundtrack, the tracks used have a good variety and are lovely to listen to.  They range from the excitement of being chased to the more romantic ones.  Each track is placed well in its respective scene.  I only wish there was an additional soundtrack or at least, somewhere in the Extras section of the Main Menu where you can listen to individual tracks.Overall, would I recommend Gilded Shadows?  As I highly enjoyed playing through all the routes, uncovering the motivations behind certain factions wanting Morgan, and experiencing the blossoming romance between Morgan and her respective love interest, I'd say that yes, I highly recommend this visual novel.  There's a lot to discover and learn about Morgan and the world she lives in, and for those who have played Changeling, another of the developer's visual novels, a particular character is mentioned.  There is no voice acting, but for this story, I think it's better that there isn't any, so the reader can imagine the characters' voices.  For the asking price, it can be on the steep side although having played through all the routes and gotten all the endings, I'd say it's worth it.  Of course, there are three additional routes that will be released, and I'll definitely return to this visual novel for them.   Finally, I want to say thank you to the developer for a curator copy of Gilded Shadows, and I know I just said it, but I'm really looking forward to those future routes.  ^^For another awesome review from Otome Lovers, please check this out:https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198889833430/recommended/1875950/ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

Kuroi Tsubasa is a visual novel developed and published by Blackwing Gaming.  You take on the role of Blackwing, a devil who wanted to come to the human world after having heard about it from his grandpa.  However, once he arrives in the human world, his shadow escapes, cauing havoc and mayhem.  As Blackwing is unable to contain it himself, he searches in a human town until he encounters Kureha, an office worker in her early 20's.  She enlists her help and turns her into a magical girl.  As Kureha shows unwavering positivity, he hopes that Kureha will be able to defeat his shadow.  Of course, the shadow is going to cause trouble, taking advantage of vulnerable humans and their emotions.  However, Blackwing and a reluctant Kureha are up to the challenge.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.As for the gameplay, Kuroi Tsubasa is a linear visual novel despite that it has multiple choices presented.  Basically, regardless of the choices that you make, you'll get the same ending.  However, certain choices can affect what CGs and/or Steam achievements are unlocked.  Since I bring it up, yes, there are LOTS of CGs as well as several Steam achievements although the achievements won't count towards a user's global total until the game is out of "profile features limited".Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  A while back, a friend recommended this visual novel although it's only now that I've gotten around to it.  Upon first playing, I found the story to have an intriguing hook.  It's narrated a lot from Blackwing's POV, and he comments on how negative humans are, which makes finding a partner difficult.  But then, he finds Kureha and enlists her help.  Although Blackwing does so initially for selfish reasons, he ends up developing a very close friendship with Kureha and because of Blackwing's actions, Kureha (who was once with hardly any friends in a foreign city, as she moved from her hometown) ends up making a motley crew of friends.  The story itself is full of comedical moments as well as dramatic ones and even a bit of horror.  I won't reveal the ending for spoiler purposes, but I'll just say that it ties everything all together.  As for the characters, I loved the cast of them here.  There are a variety of personalities.  We have Kureha, the quiet, timid office worker who initially isn't able to stand up to her supervisor.  However, as she spends time with Blackwing, Kureha develops a backbone and has confidence in herself (despite that it might waver at times).  Through Blackwing and Kureha's adventures, they end up making friends, like Puka (Kureha's office worker who loves video games and manga) and Onizuka (who looks like an intimidating Yakuza but is really a softie).  I'd name more of the characters and comment on how much I liked them, but I might go over the character limit for this review, so I'll stop here.  Suffice it to say that I enjoyed getting to meet all of the characters and learning about their backstory and whatnot.As for the writing, I found it pretty well-paced.  The events take place day-by-day, and at times, it might feel like the story is progressing a bit slowly.  However, even the slow events build up towards the dramatic moments, mainly when Kureha has to use her powers to help the person possessed by Blackwing's shadow.  I noticed places occasionally where commas could have been placed to make the sentences read more smoothly, and there was a line towards the end of the story that was untranslated.  (I played the English version, but I believe the original language is Japanese.)  As for the art, it's in the usual anime style, which I enjoyed viewing.  The backgrounds are pretty basic, but since this is a free-to-play visual novel, I can accept that.  As I mentioned earlier, there are LOTS of CGs, and they are beautiful to view.  I liked the use of colors, and I noticed that purple is present.  In regards to the soundtrack, there are several tracks and they have a good variety, from the happy-go-lucky theme to the more horror-themed one.  No voice acting is present, but it isn't necessary for this story.Overall, would I recommend Kuroi Tsubasa?  I found it a pleasant hidden gem to play, and I really enjoyed it.  For a free visual novel, the story is pretty lengthy, especially if you're a slow reader like me who enjoys taking their time.  Also, it has Steam achievements for those who like that feature.  I highly recommend giving this a try, and it's free, so there's no reason not to give it a look.  ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

Bistro Days is a slice-of-life visual novel developed by Drunk Bunny Games and published by Kikai Digital.  You take on the role of an aspiring food blogger (whose gender and name are customizable) who's trying to make a name for themselves.  (It doesn't help that the MC is overshadowed by a successful older brother and a mom who thinks that the MC should get "a real job".)  As you're taking a walk, you encounter a person in a raccoon suit, offering free drink samples.  After having taken a sample, that raccoon invites you inside Bellflower Bistro to sample the food there.  That's when you start to meet the three ladies whom the MC can form friendships and even start up a romance.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.As for the gameplay, Bistro Days has three routes: Rose (the manager), Lily (the cute waitress), and Iris (another waitress who aspires to be an Instagram star).  Thus, there are multiple choices presented throughout the story.  There are a total of 10 chapters.  The first four chapters make up the common route, and based on the choices made, you'll end up on one of the three routes.  Chapters 5 to 9 make up the individual routes and there are choices presented which will increase or decrease a lady's likability towards the MC.  Then chapter 10 is the final chapter, where there are no choices and you simply play through the rest of the story.  There are several CGs throughout the novel as well as Steam achievements (although the achievements won't count towards a user's global total until the game is out of "profile features limited").Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  Bistro Days caught my interest once I read the store description.  Although slice-of-life can be a hit or miss for me, I found this one to hit the mark.  First, I enjoyed the story itself.  It starts off a bit slow, with the MC pretty much having no direction on what to do with their life.  It doesn't help that something bad happened to their Instasnap account, so they're forced to make a new one, as well as the family issues.  However, events start to pick up once the MC makes their way to Bellflower Bistro and meets the three romance interests.  Depending on which route the MC encounters, they'll learn about that interest's particular problems.  Then, there's the excitement over the upcoming Wisteria City Competition, and yup, there's cooking involved.  XD  Speaking of the interests, I liked getting to meet all three of them.  Rose is the manager of Bellflower Bistro, and she's extremely dedicated, determined to make the restaurant a success.  However, she doesn't know when to take breaks and sometimes, pushes herself a bit too much.  Then there's Lily, the cute waitress who's the first to take the MC's order.  We learn that Lily adores animals and even wants to go to veterinary school someday to learn how to care for them.  However, she has a certain obsession that gets in the way of that.  Finally, there's Iris, another waitress who's popular on Instasnap but has a bit of an attitude towards the MC, initially being rude to the point of calling them a pervert.  However, there is a reason for Iris's attitude, which is explored as you go on her route.  I liked the diverse cast of characters, and there are a few minor characters as well, who provide great support to the story.As for the writing, I found it pretty well paced.  I noticed a few errors, mostly with lack of commas and whatnot, but overall, it was written well.  In regards to technical issues, the only one that really stood out for me was when I would use the skip feature to skip previously read text.  Sometimes, character sprites would flash/fade, which I found a bit weird.  I'm not sure what causes this error, but I thought it was worth noting.  As for the art, I like the style used.  The sprites are in the usual anime style, which feels appropriate for this story.  Colors are well used, and the backgrounds (albeit simple) are drawn well.  Of course, I love the CGs.  CGs are one of my favorite aspects about visual novels, and they're all drawn well here.  For the soundtrack, there are several tracks, and they have a bit of variety.  Most of the tracks have that everyday, light-hearted feel although since this is a slice-of-life story, they feel appropriate.  There is partial voice acting as well, and I liked the voices used.  I wish there had been more lines voiced, but I'm happy with what was present.Overall, would I recommend Bistro Days?  If you like visual novels and are in the mood for a light-hearted, slightly comedical one with fun romance interests, then I say to give this a try.  I enjoyed following the story and having the MC help each romance interest with her own problems.  One of my favorite things is the pictures of the foods that the MC would order.  They're just well done, and I only wish that I could have had those foods for real.  lol  For the asking price, I'd say it's just about worth getting since there is some voice acting as well.  It took me a little over 10 hours to get all of the achievements and CGs.  Of course, you can wait to get this on a sale, and I think it's worth getting for the fun story and beautiful art.  ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

Snips & Snails is an otome visual novel developed and published by Lacydigital.  You take on the role of Lacy Snailes (whose name is customizable - otherwise, the game takes on the default, Lacy), a university student who runs an Arcane magic shop with her dad.  The Arcane are supernatural beings, such as werewolves and vampires, and until the Reveal Act was passed, the Arcane had to hide in secrecy.  However, now they are free to be out in public without being feared from humans.  After Lacy has her dream/nightmare about her mom, who passed away years ago, Lacy goes to her classes as usual.  As she's in the library in the afternoon, a student in her math class, Sullivan, approaches her, with the excuse of returning her notebook that she lost.  He wants her to tutor him in the class, and Lacy agrees, despite her insistence that she isn't great at the subject.  Once she arrives at Sullivan's house, Lacy meets Sullivan's two brothers as well as their ghost friend.  As Lacy is encouraged to be more social by her dad and Arabella, her best friend, Lacy figures that this is a good opportunity to become friends with the guys and perhaps, even romance may blossom.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.As for the gameplay, there are multiple choices presented throughout the story.  The choices in the prologue will determine whose route you go on: Yuuto (the incubus), Quinn (the vampire), Sullivan (the caster), or Eryck (the ghost).  Once you're on a route, then you'll go through chapters one through five.  The choices you make determine whether you get the romance, happy ending plus the epilogue or the friendship/sad ending.  In addition, there are bonus stories for all four guys that can be accessed as free DLC.  There are Steam achievements although at the time of this review, they won't count towards a user's global total until the game is out of "profile features limited".  Also, there are a few CGs (mainly, of Lacy kissing the guys) although no CG gallery.  (Well, there are only four CGs in total, so that is understandable.)  There are a few tracks although no voice acting.Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  Snips & Snails is the developer's first commercial visual novel (I think), and as the store page described the presence of magic (which I always find to be interesting), I wanted the opportunity to try out this game.  First, I enjoyed the story.  It starts off a bit slow as we're introduced to Lacy and the four love interests.  However, once you're on the chapters themselves, the pace starts to pick up.  The love interests vary in personality, such as the hot-tempered Yuuto (who only seems that way initially because he and Lacy had a bad first encounter) to the mysterious Eryck (whose past is unknown).  I like how Lacy interacts with the characters and how even once you're on a path, Lacy still interacts with the other characters.  Back to the story itself, I enjoyed a certain part where Lacy's Magicka powers (because her mom had such powers, there was a chance that Lacy could, too) awaken and how, depending on which route Lacy was on, she would have a specific power.  Also, as this visual novel is labeled as "adult only", there is 18+ content.  It's mostly confined to optional described consensual sex between Lacy and the guy she chooses although this can be skipped.  While I found some routes to be on the sweeter, slower side (such as Quinn's), others were more exciting (such as Sullivan's).  Again, it depends on what happens at a specific point in the story.As for the writing, I felt that it had some pacing issues.  For example, an event would happen and then either, it would be the next day or a couple of weeks after.  It's not too big of a deal, though, since the story would go a little too slowly if it were to detail day-by-day.  Also, I didn't notice any typos although it could have used some commas in certain places.  (This might be the editor/proofreader in me being a little nitpicky, but it doesn't distract from enjoying the story itself.)As for the gameplay, I encountered a couple of issues.  First, in regards to getting the romance ending for the guys, despite that I would follow a walkthrough for getting it and I would get that ending in-game, the corresponding Steam achievement wouldn't unlock.  However, if I followed the walkthrough but simply went with alternative options for the last two or three choices (for the most part), I would then get that ending.  I don't know if this is a problem exclusive to me since I haven't heard about anyone else encountering this, but I thought I should mention it.  Also, when I played Eryck's bonus story, I encountered a Ren'Py exception error issue.  However, I simply clicked on the "Ignore" button and then I could continue to play the story.  It's a minor thing, but again, I thought I should mention it.As for the art, I liked the design of the sprites.  They're well done, and I liked the use of colors.  The backgrounds are pretty basic, but they fit well with the story's location.  As for the CGs, they are beautiful.  I like looking at kissing CGs and only wish I had taken those screenshots.  However, they're very sweet and they show how close Lacy becomes to her guy.Finally, as for the soundtrack, there are only a few tracks, so there's not a lot of variety.  However, there wasn't a point where the music suddenly stopped.  (Some visual novels have that issue, so it's good that this one didn't.)  I wish there had been one or two more tracks, but for the developer's first visual novel, I feel that the tracks present were sufficient and placed well with the mood of the story.Would I recommend Snips & Snails?  For the developer's first commercial visual novel, I feel that it is well done, overall.  It could use a bit of fixing with the above issues that I mentioned, but otherwise, I enjoyed the story a lot.  The romances were wonderful and sweet, and I just have to say this.  I'm glad I saved Eryck's route for last because his route has the most emotional feels.  XD  For the asking price, I'd say it's worth getting, as it took me over 8 hours to 100% complete the game.  (That's with using the skip feature and playing through the epilogues and side stories.)  Of course, you can wait to get it on a sale.  Finally, I want to thank the developer for this review copy and hope to have the opportunity to play future visual novels from them.  ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

How to Sing to Open Your Heart Remastered is an otome visual novel developed and published by ROSEVERTE.  It is the remastered version of the original How to Sing to Open Your Heart, which is available for purchase on Steam.  It follows up on the events of the previous game in the Eroolia series, How to Fool a Liar King Remastered.  Although this visual novel is the third game in the series, it can be played as a standalone game.  (However, I recommend playing the previous two games in the series, How to Take Off Your Mask and How to Fool a Liar King, for easier reference.)  In this installment, you take on the role of Myana, the Princess of Laarz (a kingdom of cat people).  She has come to Leezera, the capital of Eroolia (the human kingdom), as part of a pact agreed upon by the two kingdoms.  (This pact is elaborated more in How to Fool a Liar King.)  In particular, Myana has come to check up on the luccretian patients at the treatment center who are being treated for the "Inadaptability Disease".  (Again, this is elaborated more in How to Fool a Liar King.)  However, upon arriving in the human castle, she is rudely greeted by Ludovic, the imperial guard captain to King Juli.  Ludovic wants the complete isolation of luccretias.  (In other words, he doesn't want luccretias in Eroolia.)  Of course, Myana feels initially annoyed by him, and it seems like these two won't get along.  However, circumstances end up bringing these two in constant contact, and before anyone realizes, the sparks may fly between them.  I'll end my story synopsis here to avoid spoilers and all that.  XDAs for the gameplay, it's pretty much the same as in the previous two games in the series.  In the prologue, first and second chapters, you're presented with choices that will either direct you to the "teamwork" or "independent" path.  After completing the prologue, first and second chapters, you'll get a bonus mini-chapter that gives insight into what Ludovic is thinking.  Depending on the choices you make, you'll either be on the teamwork or independent path from chapter 4 all the way to the epilogue.  As for the paths themselves, the teamwork path implies that Myana will work with her friends to figure out the mystery and strange occurrences that are happening in Leezera and with regards to the luccretias.  In the independent path, Myana will still investigate although she'll mostly rely on her guardian, the black cat, for help, and there's more on screen time between her and Ludovic.  There are several CGs (with remastered artwork) throughout the story as well as a varied soundtrack.  Of course, there are Steam achievements although no Steam trading cards at the time of this review.Now that I've gone over the story and gameplay, I'll move onto my critique.  How to Sing to Open Your Heart Remastered holds a special place in my heart, partly because I helped to edit/proofread the original script.  Thus, I won't comment on the writing aspect although all other aspects are fair game.  XD  First, I enjoyed the story a lot.  It's fun getting to follow Myana as she first encounters Ludovic and immediately, the two of them don't get along.  So far, in the previous series, we've gotten the childhood friends pairing and the strangers meeting for the first time pairing.  Now, we're getting the tsundere pairing, mainly on Ludovic's side.  Although Myana is in Eroolia to help her people (and she reminds herself that she is a princess and the leader of her country), she ends up finding romance with Ludovic.  As for Ludovic, he initially just wants luccretias gone from Eroolia (although he doesn't support any harm to them).  However, as he spends time with Myana, it seems like his views on that matter may change.  Reading through the story, I liked the chemistry between Myana and Ludovic.  (I suppose it doesn't hurt that I tend to like the two people initially dislike each other but then end up liking each other over time. XD)  They make a really wonderful pair, my favorite so far in the Eroolia series.  However, because of their social positions, they find that it's difficult to be together.  Despite that, the endings for both the teamwork and independent paths leave off on a happy, hopeful note.  Ahh, before I forget, I want to point out that this visual novel is a comedy one, so it's mostly light-hearted, with plenty of romantic moments.  It does have the mystery over the luccretias and the return of anti-luccretias (who were mentioned in the first game of the series) as the main plot.As for the art, it's in the beautiful anime style that's typical for the series.  The sprites now have eye and lip movements to make the characters more realistic.  Also, a lot of the CGs are improved, so if you compare this remastered version to the original, the art is more pleasing.  In regards to the soundtrack, it is the same as in the original, so there aren't any differences.  Still, the tracks are beautiful to listen to, and there's quite a variety, each fitting with the mood of the scene.  In addition, there's full on Japanese voice acting, even for really minor characters.Overall, would I recommend How to Sing to Open Your Heart Remastered?  If you enjoyed the other games in the series and want to experience this latest installment with the improved art and such, it's certainly worth revisiting.  This story is my favorite out of all the three, and I would certainly love to see more installments.  (Also, just a personal note, but I really want more Simon and Anna.  XD)  For the asking price, I'd say it's worth it for the improved art, the soundtrack, and Japanese voice acting.  It is in a few Steam bundles, so if you already have the other games and/or DLCs in them, you can save a bit.  ^^ Please follow our curator page Otome Lovers, if you'd like to see more reviews like this one!

Гуляет девочка с собакой, а мимо идет женщина.Женщина спрашивает: "Девочка, а как тебя зовут?"-Роза-Какое красивое имя, а почему тебя так назвали?-Когда я родилась, мой папа подарил моей маме розовое масло, а капелька этого масла упала мне на лоб.-Какая красивая история, а как зовут твоего песика?-Хряк-А почему его так назвали?-Он свиней ебет

В одной международной компании заставили русского и американского антиваксеров вакцинироваться.Начальник им говорит: Вы какую вакцину ставить хотите- Pfizer или Спутник-V?- А какая разница?- У Pfizer один укол, а у Спутника два, а дальше делай что хочешь!Американец выбрал Pfizer, а русский Спутник-V. Втретились через месяц, русский спрашивает:- Ну как, укололся?- Да, один укол поставил, потемпературил, теперь свободен. А ты?- Да у нас как всегда, то шрицов на всех не хватает, то вакцину не завезли!
Чистый сэкс

ich persönlich hoffe, das die entwickler allesamt krebs bekommen, damit die merken wie beschissen es ist auf etwas warten zu müssen!!! vor allem wenn man es eilig hat oder einfach so richtig keinen bock!!! ihr seit vermutlich der grund warum cyberpunk so ne schleppende, langatmige scheiße ist! die labern selbst so langsam, erwarten aber in 2 sekunden eine entsceidung, nerven sonst alle 5 sekunden! genauso hu*ensöhne seit ihr! "Kämpfen Sie sich zur Kirche vor"!!!! der hu*ensohn läuft blind weg(weil man auf die große schlacht mit den leuten und dem panzer achtet), und danach spammt der alle 10 sek. das man den weg ja finden soll um zur statur zu kommen.... nonstop! und weil ich das nu lang genug ertragen musst, wünsche ich euch im reallife eine ähnliche situation! ich hoffe ihr bekommt ALLESAMT krebs und müsst dann zwanghaft, ungeduldig und ohne etwas überspringen zu können auf die heilung warten! das ist meine meinung! wers anders sieht kann mit einen lutschen oder sein kommentar für sich behalten! ich iggnoriere gutmenschen und gleicherlei müll sowieso grundsätzlich! wenns euch mit glück erfüllt, kommentiert das, aber ich sehs so wenig an wie die (schei*)wurst in der schüssel!
"schwer" am anfang reinzukommen, aber bockt danach schon sehr!

Игра стоит своих денег,Минус в том что в диалогах порой не совсем понятен смысл чего хотят герои,несколько раз ошибался и игра идёт совсем по другому,будьте внимательней,складывается впечатление что диалоги понятны только разработчикам игры,но это для русской версии.Очень скупы и не информативны.     Если наберётесь терпения и будете поначалу убегать от монстров или взлетать с помощью реактивного ранца дело пойдёт быстрее,далее найдёте спутника он возьмёт основную работу по уничтожению противников на себя.     Прогресс героя в игре в начальной стадии крайне медлен,но интерес от этого меньше не становится.    Выполняйте сторонние задания,открывайте умения,присоединяйтесь к одной из группировок,к какой зависит от вас и только тогда станет веселее,осваивайте навыки,магию,оружие и усиление его на верстаках,вставляйте кристаллы и смело идите в бой с напарником или без него.  Я лично рекомендую Кайю,но если хотите можете их менять они находятся все которых вы завербовали в Маленьком лагере кроме Дураса,но он начальный герой и слаб, летающий робот тоже,он присоединится к Вам как только найдёте все необходимые компоненты.  Рекомендую присоединится к берсеркам освоить магию и дистанционно уничтожать ядом,потом огнём или льдом крупных монстров,от огнестрельного и плазменного оружия урон минимален кроме огнемёта и гранатомёта,лук тоже не в деле.а ваш напарник довершит остальное...    Тактика-подходите на дальность выстрела к противнику,стреляете он бежит к вам,бежите за напарника, его уничтожает напарник.От вас требуется ему помочь.Боты тупее тупых.     Да я как понимаю с Кайей можно завязать романтические отношения она отлично дерётся отравленным мечом и огненной магией и кроме того с ней у Вас будет несколько дополнительных заданий по поиску и попытке понять элекс.   Игра интересна,по началу скучно, продолжайте играть тогда поймёте весь замысел элекса и чего реально хотят герои,это похоже на детектив, всё опутано какой то паутиной загадок.P.S.С системой диалогов в игре я впервые столкнулся Mass Effect 3,там они какие то демократичные.Здесь всё жёстче,выбрал получи что хотел,это интереснее и продуманно со смыслом.Очень чётко сработано!

Разомните кисти рук,сосредоточьтесь и вперёд.Проверьте себя,свою реакцию, насколько быстро ваши мышцы выполняют команды головного мозга,ваших нейронов...А может вы просто думаете что круты,а на самом деле тренировки не помешали бы?

Игра разработана студией id Software, а издателем выступила компания Bethesda Softworks,ну это супер я вырос на этих играх,прошёл многие,и когда эти Геймеры мысли,графики и сообщества предоставляют нам очередную игру это шедевр однозначно!!) 10 из 10Проблемы есть,после обучения основная игра не идёт,предположений много дрова новые,в инете смотрел,прог таких нет,а сносить винду даже из за супер игры пока не буду есть во что поиграть.

Шаговый подземный киберпанк,я так бы охарактеризовал данную игру.Некий человек облачается в костюм на подобии глубоководного водолаза и идёт по подземным коридорам выстланными прямоугольными плитами.По пути решает головоломки,разветвления,ловушки.Ящики с щедрым лутом.Вид от первого лица,графика достойная,это и шутер и головоломка.Если вы любите первые серии коридорного DOOM,думаю эта игра Вам понравится.Монстров там нет,но техно ловушками и техно монстрами игра изобилует.Но почему киберпанк,а не стимпанк?В игре много антиутопии. P.S Стимпанк прочно ассоциируется с киберпанком и имеет общую с ним аудиторию поклонников, но развивался как независимое течение. Основным отличием этого жанра от киберпанка можно считать полное или практически полное отсутствие в нём элементов антиутопии.Я продолжу Vaporum,Steam в переводе Пар и производные от этих слов смысловые значения.Да в этой игре много машин на пару,но это фантастическая антиутопия,а значит киберпанк).Стимпанк это идти с айфоном в ушах в средние века и слушать попсу)

В эту игру стоит поиграть любителям Экшенов.Можете выбрать за кого играть-морпехов,чужого или хищника.Вид от первого лица,графика красочная.Всё очень красиво.Для тех лет это шедевр и сейчас интересно переиграть.У каждого вида воина свои достоинства и недостатки.Рекомендую.

Игра для истинных любителей пазлов в ней нет пока карточек и значков,но,но игра состоит из нескольких книг где на каждой странице по четыре пазла разной сложности плюс в том если у Вас мало времени его можно при выходе сохранить,Пазлы очень оригинальные один цвет плавно переходит в другой да и картинки бывают очень пёстрые,а если элементы ещё  можно вращать придётся хорошо подумать...

Когда то в будущем к другой звёздной системе была запущена орбитальная станция  что бы скрытно изучать иную цивилизацию,но исчезла связь с членами экипажа и маскировка станции и что бы не возникло проблем с инопланетянами что якобы Земляне за ними шпионят,на другом корабле были посланы Вы для расследования и исправления всех проблем.Игра будет интересна для любителей фантастики и логических загадок.Этакий космический детектив,вы находите записи членов экипажа,роетесь в их личных вещах пытаясь решить загадку что случилось и где экипаж и всё это на фоне довольно неплохой графики,дизайн станции проработан основательно,я считаю что игра получилась очень оригинальной и интересной...

Довольно увлекательный сюжет в стиле Stalker,масса предметов для крафта,персонаж можно продвинуть для роста в нескольких направлениях.Кроме основного сюжета есть несколько линий дополнительных заданий-Биолог,Иженер,Интендант,и потом Учёный(возможно именно он поможет ловить аномалии и улучшить станки далее будет редакция))Пост апокалипсис,зомби,мутировавшие животные,аномалии.Надо развить персонажа,делать лекарства,оружие,и еду,кое что можно использовать сразу после нахождения,но на этом не проживёшь.Упор сделан на крафт,лут разнообразный его много надо уметь выжать из него максимум.При развитии персонажа(Перки) возьмите улучшение видения во тьме(когда присядете увидите травы,животных,противников) вообщем выживание есть выживание.Графика без наворотов,упор сделан явно на умения персонажа,всякого хлама хватает с избытком важно уметь сделать из него что то стоящее.Крафт сложный,но увлекательный.Для начала помогут лекарства.Собирайте растения,из них крафтите на костре пищу и лекарства.Дальше в Оазисе и станция Луч получите комнату,там  улучшайте верстаки.Мой совет тащите всё с перегрузом на Базу ложите в сундук там будете потом Крафт делать...И попутно зарабатывать значки.Игра Супер,сложна с элементами хоррора и очень увлекательна.Те баги которые описаны в ранних обзорах давно исправлены,приготовтесь к мозговому штурму некоторые задания требуют ваших извилин в голове.Не забывайте делать сохранения вручную методом перезаписи(!!!!!!).Важно иначе будете на базе без добытых предметов если вас убьют...

Зря что раньше не играл в этот шедевр! Очень сюжетная линия понравилась, все действо происходит в коридорах подводных станций которые последовательно приходится посещать двигаясь к Цели. В хорроры обычно не играю поэтому для меня монстры в игре пугающие, атмосфера гнетущая :)

Кроме сюжетки другие миссии и активности в игре можно описать одним словом - однообразие или зачистка разных уголков Найт-Сити от бандосов после которых еще и с горой лута приходится возиться. Новые механики тоже не впечатлили, их много, но и без них ничего страшного, в основном приходится бегать да отстреливаться. Сюжетку пройду и ладно, наобещали много, а получился ПШИК.   4/10

Да нормально зашла, герой робот, думаю свинцовая банка ибо у него привод на ядерном топливе, причем харизматичный. Вроде все банально но ГГ оказывается практически революционером к финалу игрушки. Графика тоже хороша для такого уровня. Шутеечки всякие есть, отсылки к другим игровым хитам. Прошел этим все сказано.

Игра шокирует, все что она предлагает это выбор, выбор, ВЫБОР! Мне нравится, бесконечное множество выбора. 10/10p.s. хорошо поставленный английский - закадровый голос, помогает.... или не помогает в игре.

Что тут скажешь, прошел, решил прочитать оригинал, и именно так как здесь персонажи выглядят, говорят, движения, типаж, великолепно дополнили погружение во вселенную Ведьмака при прочтении, не говоря о том, насколько качественно выполнено окружение каждого уголка, даже самого маленького. Это говорит о том насколько все проработано, огромное спасибо разработчикам! Иногда хочется все бросить и отправиться в Туссент!

Почему то именно эта часть зацепила, первую честно скажу не прошел. Очень нравится музыкальное сопровождение, прямо соответствует каждому биому, монстры натурально озвучены, услышав рев , хочется занырнуть поглубже, или как то по стеночке бочком доплыть до безопасного места, наушники только усиливают «погружение» в игровой процесс. Разработчики полируют графику, освещение, погодные эффекты, добавляют новые фишки в каждом апдейте. Игру взял из-за любопытства, что еще можно придумать, если в первой Subnautica уже все было, оказалось, есть куда идти, например … на сушу и транспорт есть для освоения и не только это. Рекомендую и жду релиза, интересно чем сюжет закончится.
Жаждешь новых достижений, и много, эта игра для тебя!
Запускал чтобы карты выбить, потом думаю дай посмотрю что это, ну и прочел/просмотрел до конца. Рисовка понравилась, линию сюжетная тоже ничего так, в общем поставлю да.
Это же Skyrim! Обожаю его, целиком и полностью!

В целом игра понравилась, поначалу ждал привычного поиска вещей и хитрокомбинаций их в инвентаре ГГ, головоломок как практически любой игре от Daedalic, но как оказалось это больше визуальная новелла, тем не менее эстетическое удовольствие от прохождения получено. Игру рекомендую!
